39 killed in clash with security forces | casualties3= 2 civilians killed during the violence }} In November 2010, there was a '''major security crisis''' in the Brazilian city of [[Rio de Janeiro]] and some of its neighboring cities. The city's criminal drug trafficking factions initiated a series of attacks in response to the government placing permanent police forces{{cite web|url=http://noticias.uol.com.br/cotidiano/2010/11/25/rio-de-janeiro-vive-guerra-contra-o-trafico-ataques-a-veiculos-continuam.jhtm|title=Rio de Janeiro vive guerra contra o tráfico; ataques a veículos continuam|publisher=noticias.uol.com.br|date= November 25, 2010|accessdate=November 27, 2010}} into Rio's slums. In response to the attacks, the local police forces with the aid of the [[Brazilian Army]] and [[Brazilian Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] initiated a large scale offensive against two of the largest drug trafficking headquarters in the city, located in the Vila Cruzeiro and the neighboring [[Complexo do Alemão]]. The operation is considered a success by the government and local media and a large quantity of illegal drugs, weapons and money were confiscated. ==Overview== Violent acts by drug dealers consisted of incinerating cars, buses and trucks on the streets (over 181 motor vehicles were incinerated{{cite web|url=http://www.jb.com.br/rio/noticias/2010/11/29/ataques-contra-veiculos-cessaram-desde-a-noite-de-domingo/|title=Ataques contra veículos cessaram desde a noite de domingo|publisher=jb.com.br|date= December 2, 2010|accessdate=December 2, 2010|language=pt}}), and armed conflicts between the police and the [[drug dealers]] at different places of those cities. Being an elevated emergency situation, the local police, along with the [[Batalhão de Operações Policiais Especiais|BOPE]], the [[Brazilian Army]], and the [[Brazilian Marine Corps]]{{cite web|url=http://www.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,beltrame-agradece-marinha-por-carros-blindados,645277,0.htm|title=Beltrame agradece Marinha e diz que operações no Rio vão continuar|publisher=Estadão.com.br|date= November 25, 2010|accessdate=November 27, 2010|language=pt}} had been summoned in order to restore the peace in the city and counter-attack the drug traffickers by taking control of their headquarters in the favelas,{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/29/world/americas/29brazil.html?ref=drug_abuse_and_traffic|title=Brazilian Forces Claim Victory in Gang Haven|publisher=New York Times|date=November 28, 2010 |accessdate=November 29, 2010}} located at the group of slums named [[Complexo do Alemão]], which was finally taken by the police around 10:00 am of November, 28.{{cite web|url=http://oglobo.globo.com/rio/mat/2010/11/28/policia-invade-complexo-do-alemao-923129542.asp|title=Polícia invade Complexo do Alemão|publisher=www.g1.globo.com|date= November 28, 2010|accessdate=November 28, 2010|language=pt}}{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/internacional/fuerzas/brasilenas/toman/control/favela/Rio/apenas/resistencia/elpepuint/20101128elpepuint_1/Tes|title=Las fuerzas brasileñas toman el control de la favela de Río sin apenas resistencia|publisher=El País|date= November 28, 2010|accessdate=November 28, 2010|language=es}} By the end of the favela violence, over 40 people (almost all of them criminals) had been killed in the conflict{{cite web|url=https://sic.sapo.pt/online/noticias/mundo/violencia+entre+policia+e+traficantes+no+rio+de+janeiro+ja+fez+39+mortos.htm|title=Violência entre polícia e traficantes no Rio de Janeiro já fez 39 mortos|publisher=www.sic.sapo.pt/online/homepage|date= November 26, 2010|accessdate=November 27, 2010|language=pt}} and over 200 people arrested. Though the attacks ended, the police and military forces still occupy the [[Complexo do Alemão]], the largest favela in the city of Rio de Janeiro. ==Timeline of the crisis== ;November 21 :In the afternoon, six heavily armed individuals incinerated two cars at [[Linha Vermelha]], one of Rio's most important highways. Since then similar attacks started occurring throughout the city and another group of criminals opened fire against a [[Brazilian Air Force]] Vehicle. ;November 22 :A police captain was shot at Dom Helder Camara Avenue. In addition to the attacks on cars, mass robberies happen in some streets. The government implies that "a small criminal faction" is responsible for the attacks and patrolling is increased. Three people were killed. ;November 23 :A large scale operation from Rio's Military police invaded several slums of the city in search of those responsible for the series of attacks. Some sources indicate that the order for the attacks came from drug lords imprisoned in the [[Catanduvas prison|Catanduvas Federal Maximum Security Prison]]. Three people died and five were arrested. ;November 24 :The attacks on civilian and police targets intensify. The government declares an order calling all able members of the police force to reinforce patrols including those on license and performing administrative duties. Eight criminals imprisoned in the city responsible for taking part in the crisis are transferred to the Catanduvas Prison. Fifteen suspects were killed and at least thirty were arrested. The local government asked for the [[Brazilian Marine Corps]]' support to launch a counter offensive on the criminals. ;November 25 :The Rio's Special Task Forces (BOPE) invades one of the city's most dangerous areas at the [[Vila Cruzeiro]] with the aid of several Marine Corps' armored vehicles. Dozens of criminals desperately fled to their nearby headquarters at the [[Complexo do Alemão]]. Details of the operation, including the criminals' run, are broadcast by the local TV stations to the whole world. ;November 26 :The Brazilian government sent hundreds of soldiers from the Army and members of the Federal Police Force to further increase security in the city and put the Complexo do Alemão under siege. So far more than 100 vehicles were destroyed and around 40 people killed since the start of the crisis. The President [[Luís Inácio Lula da Silva]] declares that the Federal Government fully supports Rio's government to end the situation as soon as possible. Spouses and lawyers of some of the imprisoned leaders of the criminal factions are arrested on suspicion of relaying their orders to start the attacks to their cohorts out of prison. ;November 27 :The Joint task force composed of members of the local police, Army and Marine Corps gives an ultimatum to the criminals at the [[Complexo do Alemão]] to surrender while residents evacuate the premises in spite of the impending invasion. The wave of attacks on civilian targets start to fade. ;November 28 :The Complexo do Alemão is taken over by the police with little resistance, but only a few criminals supposed to be hiding in the place are arrested. Further investigations point that the majority managed to escape through rough terrains around the Complex or through a network of illegal water canals built under the favelas. ===Aftermath=== Just after the occupation of the Complexo do Alemão and Vila Cruzeiro by the Army, the attacks on vehicles stopped and crisis came to an end. The police managed to apprehend around 40 tonnes of [[marijuana]] and 250 kilos of [[cocaine]] along with many other illicit drugs, dozens of weapons including pistols, assault rifles, explosives, machine guns, hundreds of stolen motorcycles and more than 30 stolen cars. The drugs were destroyed while the police were charged with the task of returning the stolen vehicles to their rightful owners. The losses suffered by the criminals are stated to surpass 200 million reais (around 120 million US dollars), not including the confiscated houses belonged to the faction's main leaders, fully equipped with many luxury items including multiple pools, jacuzzis and high level electronic hardware. Through a deal between the State government and the Federal government, the troops will remain stationed in the occupied area until a permanent police force is installed to maintain security. Despite the fact that most of the criminals managed to escape, the operation is considered by the local media as a major victory against crime in Rio de Janeiro and a turning point in the war against drug trafficking in Brazil. ==See also== {{Portal|Brazil}} * [[2006 São Paulo violence outbreak]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Commons category-inline|Atos de violência organizada no Rio de Janeiro em novembro de 2010|2010 Rio de Janeiro Security Crisis}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rio De Janeiro Security Crisis, 2010}} [[Category:2010 in Brazil]] [[Category:Murder in 2010]] [[Category:Rio de Janeiro (state)]] [[Category:History of drug control]] [[Category:Terrorism in Brazil]] [[Category:Organized crime events]] [[Category:Operations against organized crime]] [[Category:Law enforcement in Brazil]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2010]] [[Category:Organized crime conflicts]] [[Category:Organized crime events in Brazil]] [[Category:November 2010 events]]

[[File:The Evil Clown.jpg|thumb|A person dressed as an [[evil clown]] in 2007.]] The '''2016 clown sightings''' were reports of people disguised as armed [[evil clown]]s in incongruous settings, such as near forests and schools. The incidents were reported in the [[United States]], [[Canada]], and subsequently in other countries and territories from August 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Creepy clown sightings reported in more communities in South Carolina|url=http://fox8.com/2016/09/02/creepy-clown-sightings-reported-in-more-communities-in-south-carolina/|publisher=[[WJW (TV)]]|access-date=September 3, 2016}}</ref><ref name="nytimes article">{{cite news|last1=Rogers|first1=Katie|title=Creepy Clown Sightings in South Carolina Cause a Frenzy|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/31/us/creepy-clown-sightings-in-south-carolina-cause-a-frenzy.html?_r=0|website=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=NYTimes.com|accessdate=September 3, 2016|date=August 30, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=McGurty|first1=Frank|last2=Prentice|first2=Chris|title=Clown sightings spook South Carolina, perplex police|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/clown-sightings-spook-south-carolina-perplex-police-202822588.html|website=[[Yahoo!]]|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=September 3, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Harris|first1=Chris|title=South Carolina Police Chief to Creepy Clowns: 'The Clowning Around Needs to Stop'|url=http://www.people.com/article/south-carolina-police-chief-says-clowning-around-needs-to-stop|website=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=People.com|accessdate=September 3, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/killer-clowns-inside-the-terrifying-hoax-sweeping-america-w442649|title='Killer Clowns': Inside the Terrifying Hoax Sweeping America|date=2016-09-30|author=Zuppello, Suzanne|work=[[Rolling Stone]]}}</ref> The sightings were first reported in [[South Carolina]] when a 9-year-old boy told his mother that two suspicious males dressed as [[clown]]s tried to lure him into the nearby woods.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2016/oct/05/clown-sightings-south-carolina-alabama|title=Clown sightings: the day it all began|date=2016-10-05|author=Teague, Matthew|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''}}</ref> By mid-October 2016, clown sightings and attacks had been reported in nearly all [[U.S. state]]s, 9 out of 13 [[provinces and territories of Canada]], and 18 other countries.
Prior to the spate of incidents in 2016, numerous sightings of people dressed as clowns in odd or incongruous settings have occurred throughout the world since 2013. The proliferation of videos and images of these precursor sightings spread through social media posts and viral sharing of the content, most notably from [[DM Pranks]], a YouTube user from [[Perugia]], Italy.<ref name="DM Pranks"/>
While most of the 2016 incidents appeared to be wholly unsubstantiated or lacked evidence of criminal activity (with many incidents being deemed [[practical jokes]]), a few led to arrests. Some people were cited or arrested for making violent threats to schools, and some incidents involved robberies and assaults on children and adults.<ref name="KOTV">{{cite web|url=http://www.newson6.com/story/33402994/pryor-woman-attacked-by-woman-two-men-wearing-clown-masks|title=Pryor Woman Attacked By Woman, Two Men Wearing Clown Masks|date=2016-10-16|publisher=[[KOTV-DT]]}}</ref><ref name="concord"/><ref name="phoenix"/>
By mid-October 2016, in the wake of hundreds of "clown sightings" in the United States and Canada, the phenomenon had spread from North America to Europe, Israel, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South America. {{TOC limit|3}}
==Scope, timeline and effects of sightings==
===Precursor sightings=== One possible precursor event was the 2013 sightings of a "creepy clown" in [[Northampton, England]]. The Northampton clown sightings, which were in the town during September and October 2013, were the work of three local filmmakers Alex Powell, Elliot Simpson, and Luke Ubanski.<ref name="Northampton">{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2013/10/northampton-clown-unmasked/309900/|title=Northampton Solves the Mystery of The Creepy Clown|first=Connor|last=Simpson|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref> The clown shared similar looks to [[It (character)|Pennywise the Dancing Clown]] from Stephen King's book ''It''. The trio started a [[Facebook]] page for the so-called "Northampton clown" and were using the appearances to drive traffic to the page.<ref name="Northampton"/>
In March 2014, Matteo Moroni from [[Perugia]], [[Italy]], owner of the YouTube channel [[DM Pranks]], began dressing up as an evil clown and terrifying unsuspecting passersby, with his videos racking up hundreds of millions of views.<ref name="DM Pranks">{{cite news|title=Why I am a 'killer clown'|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-37612735|agency=BBC|date=25 October 2016}}</ref> A rash of sightings appeared in [[California]] in October 2014, which centered around the "Wasco clown", and primarily occurred in the [[Wasco, California]] area with photos appearing on social media.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/mysterious-clowns-terrorizing-california-city/story?id=26157014|title=Mysterious Clowns Terrorizing California City|first=A. B. C.|last=News|date=13 October 2014|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref>
A person in clown attire was spotted in a cemetery in [[Chicago, Illinois]] in July 2015. This occurrence involved two residents who spotted the "creepy clown" scaling the gate at the Rosehill Cemetery late at night. After the clown entered the cemetery, they turned to face the residents and began waving slowly as they made a video recording. After waving for a few seconds, the clown ran into a dark wooded area and was not seen again. Police investigation of the sighting did not lead to any arrests.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/creepy-clown-trespasses-in-chicago-cemetery_us_55b2810ae4b0224d88322911|title=Creepy Clown Menaces Chicago Cemetery|first1=David Moye|last1=Reporter|first2=The Huffington|last2=Post|date=24 July 2015|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref>
===2016 sightings and effects=== The 2016 clown phenomenon began in [[Greenville, South Carolina]] in early August, followed by incidents in [[Canada]] shortly afterward. It later spread around the U.S.<ref name="morrisjd"/>
In early October 2016, further incidents were reported in Canada and the first occurrences in the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Australia]]. British communities were described as "horrified" and pressure had been placed on police resources.<ref name="Scotland Courier" />
Throughout this time, Internet social media sites received numerous postings related to the phenomenon. The [[World Clown Association]] president Randy Christensen took a stance against the current trend of people dressing up as clowns to frighten people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=11726226|title=Clown president: 'We don't want to scare people'|date=10 October 2016|publisher=New Zealand Herald}}</ref> [[Circus]]es<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/crime/85198339/waikato-clown-attacks-no-laughing-matter|title=Circus clown: Stop giving us a bad name|date=|work=stuff.co.nz}}</ref> and other clown-related businesses were affected.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=11726932|title=How the creepy clown craze is killing the entertainment profession|author=Vanessa Brown|date=11 October 2016|publisher=New Zealand Herald|accessdate=12 October 2016}}</ref> In October 2016, [[McDonald's]] decided that [[Ronald McDonald]] would keep a lower profile as a result of the incidents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/news/article.cfm?c_id=3&objectid=11727159|title=McDonald's: Ronald McDonald keeping a lower profile|date=12 October 2016|publisher=New Zealand Herald}}</ref> A sociologist has called 2016 "a bad time to be a professional clown".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11727427|title=Clown craze: It's going to peak, it's going to be here in New Zealand|author=Patricia Greig|date=|work=NZ Herald}}</ref> The killer clown craze has been linked to a significant increase in sales of clown suits in and near [[Glasgow]], [[Scotland]].<ref>[http://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/glasgow-news/killer-clown-suits-selling-out-12019149 Fancy dress shop say their costume was used in 'killer clown' prank] Retrieved October 2016</ref> During Halloween, some Floridians decided to go armed while trick-or-treating.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/armed-trick-or-treating-florida-halloween_us_5816fe9de4b064e1b4b33a28|title=Creepy Clown Threat Prompts Spooked Floridians To Trick-Or-Treat While Armed|author=Lee Moran|work=The Huffington Post|date=31 October 2016|accessdate=1 November 2016}}</ref>
===Warnings=== On October 12, the [[Embassy of Russia, London|Russian Embassy in London]] issued a warning for Russian and British citizens because of the clown scare.<ref>{{cite web|title=Russian Embassy warns citizens about British 'clowns'... while locked in Syria stand-off with Boris Johnson|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/russian-embassy-warns-citizens-british-9032895|publisher=''[[Mirror.co.uk]]''|date=October 12, 2016}}</ref>
On October 13, [[Fiji]]an police warned people against involvement in the events.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fijisun.com.fj/2016/10/13/police-warn-against-clowns-movement/|title= Police Warn Against Clowns Movement|date=|work=Fiji Sun Online}}</ref>
===Clown costume bans and withdrawals=== Several New Zealand shops have withdrawn clown costumes from their shelves.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11729162|title=Halloween clown outfits pulled from Kiwi hire shop shelves|date=15 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016|via=New Zealand Herald}}</ref> The [[East Side Union High School District]], the [[West Milford, New Jersey|West Milford]] school district, Ohio school district, and Springboro Community Schools,<ref name="springboro">{{Cite news|url=http://www.whio.com/news/crime--law/local-elementary-school-banning-clown-costumes-masks/JDjhOCcDilOo1t4set2aO/|title=Local elementary school banning clown costumes, masks|date=October 18, 2016|accessdate=October 18, 2016|publisher=[[WHIO-TV]]}}</ref> issued a blanket ban on all clown costumes and clown masks in addition to previously existing policies and restrictions. [[Target Corporation|Target]] has pulled clown masks from its website and stores as a result of the scare,<ref>{{cite web|author=Pheifer, Pat|title=Target pulls clown masks from stores and website due to 'crazy clown' scares|url=http://www.startribune.com/target-pulls-clown-masks-from-stores-and-website-due-to-crazy-clown-scares/397250961/|publisher=''[[Star Tribune]]''|date=October 16, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/oct/16/clowns-scary-black-lives-matter-arizona-halloween|title=Clown sightings: hysteria in the US reaches a fever pitch|author=Walters, Joanna|date=2016-10-16|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-target-clown-masks-20161017-story.html|title=Target halts clown-mask sales amid creepy-clown hysteria|author=Wang, Amy B.|date=2016-10-17|publisher=''[[Chicago Tribune]]''}}</ref> as has [[Canadian Tire]]. The village of [[Memramcook, New Brunswick]] asked residents not to dress up as clowns on Halloween.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/no-laughing-matter-n-b-village-asks-residents-to-ditch-the-clown-costumes-this-halloween-1.3137014|title=No laughing matter: N.B. village asks residents to ditch the clown costumes this Halloween|author=Jonathan MacInnis|date= October 28, 2016|work=CTV News Atlantic|accessdate=29 October 2016}}</ref> Employees of theme parks were instructed to remove any horror costumes and make-up before leaving work.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/theme-park-staff-told-to-take-off-clown-costumes-sg3dvxm3c|title=Theme park staff told to take off clown costumes|date=2016-10-17|publisher=''[[The Times]]''}}</ref>
===Threatened "clown purge" and aftermath=== By October 25, 2016, several news outlets reported on an alleged clown-initiated "purge" or "attack", which supposedly was to take place on Halloween Eve of 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wspa.com/2016/10/24/clown-purge-rumor-targets-greenville/|title=Clown purge rumor targets Greenville|first=Eryn|last=Rogers|date=25 October 2016|work=wspa.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.morningledger.com/killer-clown-purge-2016-where-when-will-the-clowns-attack/13114695/|title=Killer Clown Purge 2016: Where & When Will The Clowns Attack?|date=25 October 2016|work=morningledger.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.morningledger.com/map-of-killer-clowns-purge-2016-which-states-will-be-attacked/13115157/|title=Map of Killer Clowns Purge 2016: Which States Will Be Attacked?|date=26 October 2016|publisher=}}</ref> While there were no widespread "purge" attacks as threatened, a family from Florida were attacked on October 31, 2016 by a group of approximately 20 people in clown masks (and masks styled after ''[[The Purge]]'' movie). No arrests were made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/local/victim-recognizes-teen-during-brutal-attack-by-20-people-in-the-purge-clown-masks/462664786|title=Victim recognizes teen during brutal attack by 20 people in 'The Purge,' clown masks|last=EndPlay|date=1 November 2016|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wesh.com/article/men-attacked-by-mob-in-orange-county/8065071|title=Man says he was random target of masked Halloween mob attack in East Orange County|first=Amanda|last=Ober|date=1 November 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
The sightings inspired the upcoming [[horror film]] titled ''[[Behind the Sightings]]'', directed by Tony Cadwell.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/tommy-v-behind-the-sightings-film-1202103283/|title=Tommy V Nabs Clown Epidemic Thriller 'Behind The Sightings'|author=Amanda N'Duka|date=31 May 2017|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|access-date=1 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3439923/clown-film-behind-sightings-will-ripped-headlines-horror/|title=Scary Clown Film 'Behind The Sightings' is Ripped from the Headlines|author=John Squires|date=31 May 2017|website=[[Bloody Disgusting]]|access-date=1 June 2017}}</ref>
==Incidents== {{cleanup section|reason=un-encyclopedic style of writing, repetitive phrasing, mixed use of tenses, a list of trivial non-notable examples and [[WP:TOOMUCH]] |date=September 2018}}
{{dynamic list}}
===Australia=== On October 7, several of these sightings were reported in [[Campbelltown, New South Wales]]. Four images of sightings in the city were uploaded onto the Internet and one showed a clown being knocked to the ground.<ref>{{cite web|author=Duggan, Adam|url=http://www.9news.com.au/national/2016/10/07/14/59/menacing-clown-sightings-reported-in-australia|title=Menacing clown sightings reported in Australia|publisher=''[[9 News]]''|date=October 7, 2016}}</ref> Since October 7, there have been multiple sightings across major Australian cities, which include [[Sydney]], [[Melbourne]], [[Brisbane]], [[Adelaide]], and [[Perth]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/clown-purge-craze-scary-clown-craze-spreads-to-australia-police-warn-its-no-joke/news-story/2adce242cf33471de5d1500acc87935a|title=Clown 'purge' craze: Scary clown craze spreads to Australia, police warn it's no joke|date=October 7, 2016|work=dailytelegraph.com.au}}</ref>
On October 8, at around 9:30 PM, two 12-year-old girls were with one of their fathers buying ice cream when suddenly, they were attacked by a creepy clown in Adelaide's CBD (Central Business District) near the intersection of Pultney Street and Rundle Street. While attacking the girls, the clown tried to steal one of the girls' phone.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/news/south-australia/creepy-clown-terrorises-two-12yearold-girls-in-adelaides-cbd/news-story/54185eba7682d55a5259a9f10241c88d|title=Creepy clown terrorises two 12-year-old girls in Adelaide's CBD|author=Jordanna Schriever|work=The Advertiser|date=October 9, 2016}}</ref>

The incidents in Brazil and worldwide led to professional clowns protesting in [[Rio Grande do Sul]] in late October.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/latam/201610231046634145-brazil-clown-attacks-demonstration/|title=Brazil's 'Good Clowns' Fight Back Against Creepy Clown Attackers|publisher=''[[Sputnik News]]''|date=October 23, 2016}}</ref>

====Nova Scotia==== In early October, people dressed as clowns were sighted in [[Halifax, Nova Scotia|Halifax]], [[Hammonds Plains, Nova Scotia|Hammonds Plains]], and [[Dartmouth, Nova Scotia]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/halifax/2016/10/04/halifax-police-creepy-clown-sightings-not-wise-thing-to-do.html?cq_ck=1475616467089|title=Stop clowning around: Halifax police say creepy clown sightings not 'wise thing to do'|author= Nicole Gnazdowsky|date=4 October 2016|work=metronews.ca|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>

Witnesses reported that he grabbed at the clothing of a young boy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/2987082/man-wearing-creepy-clown-mask-arrested-in-southwestern-nova-scotia/|title=Man wearing creepy clown mask arrested in southwestern Nova Scotia|date=6 October 2016|work=Global News|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref>
====Nunavut==== In the first half of October, there were several reports of people dressed as clowns in the hamlet of [[Rankin Inlet]], [[Nunavut]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nunatsiaqonline.ca/stories/article/65674nunavut_community_reports_creepy_clown_sightings/|title=Nunavut community reports creepy clown sightings|author=Sarah Rogers|date=2016-10-13|work=nunatsiaqonline.ca}}</ref>
====Ontario==== In early October, people dressed as clowns were spotted chasing children during dismissal at Pope Francis Catholic School, an elementary school in Toronto. Police detained two 15-year-olds in connection with the incident. It is believed they are former students of the school and they were filming their activities for a [[YouTube]] video. Police have said that the suspects did not touch the students.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cp24.com/news/two-people-in-clown-costumes-chased-students-at-west-end-school-police-1.3103324|title=Teen in clown costume chases students at west-end school: police|author=Chris Fox|date=5 October 2016|work=cp24.com|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref> In addition, the [[Toronto Catholic District School Board]] spokesperson John Yan said that a group named "Clowns in the 6" have specifically named different high schools in Toronto as targets for potential clown attacks.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/group-of-clowns-threaten-taunt-tcdsb-students-1.3103333|title=Group of clowns threaten, taunt TCDSB students|author=Courtney Greenberg|date=5 October 2016|work=ctvnews.ca|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 6, 2016, a group of people dressed as clowns made a message on an [[Instagram]] account saying: "We are coming to [[London, Ontario]]'s high schools and surrounding areas. We are going to kidnap students and behead teachers, we're not clowning around."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfpress.com/2016/10/06/threat-says-clowns-coming-to-all-london-high-schools-to-kidnap-students-and-kill-teachers|title=Clown threat sent to London high school students|last=nurun.com|date=|work=lfpress.com}}</ref> The account gained attention in the city of London as well as [[St. Thomas, Ontario|Saint Thomas]] and [[Middlesex County, Ontario|surrounding towns and municipalities]]. A few days later, a student at Mother Teresa Catholic Secondary School in North London was approached by a man wearing a clown costume. The man sprinted at her, coming close to the school itself. Numerous students captured photos on the social media application [[Snapchat]], as the man ran from the property. [[Clarke Road Secondary School]] and [[H. B. Beal Secondary School|H.B. Beal Secondary School]] were both [[Lockdown|put under lock-downs]] during the following days. During the height of this "clown epidemic", [[London District Catholic School Board]] banned students from wearing clown costumes during Halloween celebrations that year.
====Quebec==== On August 9, people dressed as clowns were reported to have been chasing children in [[Gatineau]], Quebec.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/ottawa/2016/08/10/police-investigating-after-clowns-scare-kids-in-gatineau.html|title=Police investigating after creepy clowns chase kids in Gatineau|author=Haley Ritchie|date=10 August 2016|work=metronews.ca|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 2, a video surfaced of a person dressed as a clown in the middle of a dirt road in Quebec, with a chainsaw that chased after a car on foot.<ref>{{cite web|title=Creepy Clown Sighting Caught On Camera – Quebec Canada 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNV8cfexzX4|website=YouTube|accessdate=15 October 2016}}</ref> On October 14, in [[Montreal]], a teenager was chased by a clown with a baseball bat; he called the police, but the culprit was never found.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://montrealgazette.com/news/local-news/clowns|title=As creepy clowns spread to Quebec, life gets tricky for working clowns|date=25 October 2016|work=montrealgazette.com|accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref>
===Chile=== In October, a male dressed as a clown was filmed walking around with a baseball bat in [[Rancagua]], [[Cachapoal Province]], pursuing the recorder and his group of friends.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.concierto.cl/blog/2016/10/ya-estan-aqui-payasos-asesinos-llegaron-chile/|title=They're here: Murderers Clowns came to Chile|publisher=''Concierto''|date=October 12, 2016}}</ref>
===Croatia=== Sightings in Croatia begun on October 16 in [[Osijek]], then followed in other cities, such as [[Karlovac]] and [[Trilj]]. Some teenagers allegedly beat a person dressed as a clown in Osijek and on October 21, the first three people dressed as clowns were arrested in Karlovac. On October 22, another person dressed as a clown was arrested<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/uhicen-klaun-u-varazdinu-mahao-sjekirom-i-plasio-prolaznike/927680.aspx|title=Uhićen klaun u Varaždinu, mahao sjekirom i plašio prolaznike|date=|work=index.hr}}</ref> in [[Varaždin]]. Croatian minister of interior affairs Vlaho Orepić said in an interview for RTL TV<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vijesti.rtl.hr/novosti/hrvatska/1974101/u-pricu-oko-zlokobnih-klaunova-se-ukljucio-i-ministar-nema-tolerancije-ako-gradjani-strahuju/|title=U priču oko zlokobnih klaunova se uključio i ministar: 'Nema tolerancije ako građani strahuju!'|last=Vijesti.hr|date=|work=rtl.hr}}</ref> that Croatian police would deal with that issue and ensure safety of citizens.
===Denmark=== Police districts across the country have received 22 reports of sightings in total by October 17, 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dr.dk/nyheder/indland/over-20-episoder-med-onde-klovne-22-aarig-mand-skraemt-med-oekse|title=Over 20 episoder med onde klovne: 22-årig mand skræmt med økse|date=|work=|newspaper=DR|access-date=2016-10-17|via=}}</ref>
On October 12, 2016, a man was driving home from a football match when he spotted an axe-wielding male dressed as a clown standing in the middle of the road. The man nearly hit the clown, who was later revealed to be a 13-year-old boy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nyheder.tv2.dk/krimi/2016-10-13-uhyggelig-trend-er-naaet-til-danmark-peter-blev-skraemt-af-klovn-med-oekse|title=Uhyggelig trend er nået til Danmark: Peter blev skræmt af klovn med økse|date=2016-10-13|newspaper=nyheder.tv2.dk|language=da-DK|access-date=2016-10-13}}</ref>
On October 14, a man in [[Holbæk]] was followed by a male dressed as a clown. He managed to punch the clown in the face. Police stated that both parties risked prosecution.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nyheder.tv2.dk/krimi/2016-10-17-politiets-anbefaling-det-skal-du-goere-hvis-du-moeder-skraemmende-klovn|title=Politiets anbefaling: Det skal du gøre, hvis du møder skræmmende klovn|date=2016-10-17|newspaper=nyheder.tv2.dk|language=da-DK|access-date=2016-10-17}}</ref>
===Finland=== On October 18, there were two sightings of people dressed as clowns in [[Tuusula]]. First, around 10 people dressed as clowns jumped out of a grey van at the playyard of school. They started to hunt down three kids who escaped to an underpass, where another clown was waiting with a chainsaw. Later, two adults with white overalls and pig masks were running behind at least one child and scared teenagers. On the evening of 22 October in the [[Kallio]] district of [[Helsinki]], two clowns jumped in front of a 30-year-old man, who was jogging with his dog. The dog bit one and the man punched another of the clowns. However, the clowns managed to escape. The man made a police report of the incident, and the police did not find the suspects. There were also sightings of people dressed as clowns in [[Turku]], [[Luvia]], [[Vaasa]], [[Rovaniemi]], [[Porvoo]], [[Espoo]], [[Vantaa]], [[Nurmijärvi]], [[Kotka]], [[Rauma, Finland|Rauma]], [[Riihimäki]], [[Savonlinna]], [[Oulu]], [[Kerimäki]], [[Pieksämäki]], [[Varkaus]] and [[Leppävirta]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hs.fi/kotimaa/a1476760926838 |title=Pelkoa herättänyt klovni-ilmiö levisi Suomeenkin – silminnäkijät kertoneet tapauksista eri puolilla maata |last=Kerkelä |first=Lasse |date=18 October 2016 |website=[[Helsingin Sanomat]] |access-date=19 October 2016 |language=Finnish}}</ref>
===Germany=== On October 15, at 2:00 AM in [[Wesel]], two men reported a man in a clown mask carrying a knife and gun.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/panorama/welt/wenn-alptraeume-wahr-werden-erster-horror-clown-in-deutschland-aufgetaucht_id_6075582.html |title=Wesel: Erster Grusel-Clown bedroht Passanten in Deutschland – FOCUS Online |language=de|website=Focus.de |date= |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref>

Another in the same town threatened a 15-year-old with a knife. In nearby [[Greifswald]], two separate reports involved a clown wielding a [[chain saw]]. Two other incidents in Greifswald involved young children being scared by someone dressed as a clown.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://jpupdates.com/2016/10/21/creepy-clown-scare-spreads-to-germany/ |work=Jewish Political News and Updates |title= Creepy Clown Scare Spreads to Germany |date=2016-10-21 |accessdate=2016-10-21 |language=en |last1=Chu |first1=Joyce}}</ref><ref>[http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/rostock-clown-attackiert-teenager-mit-baseballschlaeger-a-1117653.html ''Schläger im Clownskostüm verletzt Teenager'']. Spiegel Online, 2016-10-21 (German)</ref>
On October 25, a 16-year-old masked as a clown was stabbed with a knife by a 14-year-old in [[Berlin]]. The 16-year-old had to undergo surgery.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/gesellschaft/kriminalitaet/horror-clown-muss-nach-messerstich-notoperiert-werden-14497319.html |title=Grusel-Clown muss nach Messerstich notoperiert werden |language=de|website=faz.net |date= |accessdate=2016-10-25}}</ref>
On October 29, the [[Federal Ministry of the Interior (Germany)|German Interior Ministry]] announced a "zero-tolerance policy" against creepy clown attire ahead of Halloween. It was reported that over the past several weeks in Germany, there had been 30 reports of incidents involving attacks, robberies, or assaults.<ref name="zerotolerance">{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/10/29/germany-announces-zero-tolerance-policy-against-creepy-clowns-ahead-of-halloween|title=Germany announces 'zero tolerance' policy against creepy clowns ahead of Halloween|first=Nick|last=Roack|date=October 29, 2016|accessdate=October 29, 2016|publisher=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref>

===Mexico=== On October 5, residents of [[Monterrey]], [[Nuevo León]] made warnings on [[Facebook]] that thieves dressing as clowns were present in the area. The Facebook group's alert said that the clowns assaulted a passersby, who were walking home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hoyestado.com/2016/10/alertan-sobre-payasos-delincuentes-en-monterrey/|title=Alertan sobre "payasos" delincuentes en Monterrey|trans-title=Warn of "clowns" criminals in Monterrey|publisher=''[[Hoy (U.S. newspaper)|Hoy]]''|date=October 5, 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unimexicali.com/noticias/mexico/440712/alertan-por-payasos-asaltantes-en-monterrey.html|title=Warn of 'clowns assailants' in Monterrey|publisher=''Agencies''|date=October 5, 2016|accessdate=October 6, 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref>
On the early morning of October 7, several news sources reported that two males dressed as clowns were found dead in [[Ecatepec]], a suburb of [[Mexico City]], possibly due to being beaten to death by a group of people after the clowns were scaring people.<ref name="posta">{{cite web|url=http://www.posta.com.mx/edomex/matan-dos-payasos-que-asustaban-mujeres-y-ninos-en-ecatepec|title=Matan a dos payasos que asustaban a mujeres y niños en Ecatepec|trans-title=Clowns kill two frightened women and children in Ecatepec|publisher=''Posta''|date=October 7, 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref> This turned out to be false. The news sites reporting the incident used a photo of two clowns murdered in Guatemala in March 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/chimaltenango/mueren-baleados-dos-hombres-disfrazados-de-payasos|title=Mueren baleados dos hombres disfrazados de payasos|newspaper=Prensa Libre|access-date=2016-10-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://mexiconewsdaily.com/news/the-killer-clown-craze-arrives-in-mexico/|title=Killer clown craze arrives in Mexico|publisher=mexiconewsdaily.com|date=October 11, 2016}}</ref>
===New Zealand=== Sightings were reported in several New Zealand cities,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11725537|title=Paranoia rising over scary clown epidemic in NZ|author=Nikki Preston|date=9 October 2016|publisher=New Zealand Herald}}</ref> such as in Auckland where a creepy clown was caught on camera at the [[University of Auckland]] library.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11727588|title=Creepy clown caught on camera at university|publisher=New Zealand Herald|date=October 2016}}</ref>
====Dunedin==== A man dressed as a clown was arrested in [[Dunedin]] for scaring passersby.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/85402317/clowns-allegedly-brandishing-weapons-arrested-in-dunedins-student-quarter|title=Clown 'scaring passers-by' arrested in Dunedin's student quarter |publisher=|date=October 2016}}</ref> Four people dressed as clowns stood outside a teenager's home, threatening to kill her.<ref>{{cite web|title=Axe-wielding clown threatens to kill Dunedin teen |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/85548232/axewielding-clown-threatens-to-kill-dunedin-teen|date=October 2016}}</ref>
====Hamilton==== In the first half of October, a woman was attacked by two people dressed as clowns.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/crime/85115578/clown-attackers-assault-woman-walking-home-in-hamilton|title='Clown' attackers assault woman walking home in Hamilton|author=Phillipa Yalden|date=8 October 2016|work=Stuff|accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
In the second half of October, a person dressed as a clown stole a box of beer and handed it to a bicycling accomplice.<ref>{{cite web|title=Clown steals box of beer in Hamilton liquor store theft |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/crime/85564651/clown-steals-box-of-beer-in-hamilton-liquor-store-theft|author=PHILLIPA YALDEN, TE AHUA MAITLAND |date=October 2016|work=Stuff}}</ref>
====Towns and smaller locations==== A woman's three sons were playing basketball at Discovery School in [[Porirua]] and one of the sons was approached by a person dressed as a clown. The mother then called the police. A police spokesperson urged for the community to be calm.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/dominion-post/news/porirua/85031320/Police-urge-calm-as-Porirua-clown-sighting-spreads-panic|title=Police urge calm as Porirua clown sighting spreads panic|publisher=''[[The Dominion Post (Wellington)|Dominion Post]]''|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
In mid-October 2016, a male wearing a clown mask was a tyre-slashing suspect in [[Timaru]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/timaru-herald/news/85290098/clown-mask-worn-by-suspected-tyre-slasher|title=Clown mask worn by suspected Timaru tyre slasher|publisher=Timaru Herald|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref>
===Netherlands=== On October 10, various incidents were reported of a person dressed as a clown wielding a knife chasing and scaring children in [[Almere Buiten]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ad.nl/dossier-nieuws/eerste-horrorclown-gesignaleerd-in-nederland~a21e4f43/ | title=Eerste 'horrorclown' gesignaleerd in Nederland | accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> The police have started an official investigation to find the person responsible and have publicly requested that they identify themselves and to stop causing public unrest.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rtlnieuws.nl/nederland/nu-ook-in-nederland-politie-almere-waarschuwt-voor-killer-clowns | title=Nu ook in Nederland? Politie Almere waarschuwt voor 'killer clowns' | accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
A person dressed as a clown was sighted in Ruwaard on October 10 and 11.
On October 14, a 17-year-old boy dressed as a clown was arrested in [[Roermond]], [[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]] for jumping towards drivers and scaring them.<ref>{{cite web|author=Pieters, Janene|url=http://www.nltimes.nl/2016/10/17/killer-clown-arrested-roermond/|title=KILLER CLOWN ARRESTED IN ROERMOND|publisher=''[[NL Times]]''|date=October 17, 2016}}</ref>
===Norway=== On October 11, in [[Bodø]], two youths wearing clown masks were wielding bats and sticks and scaring people. The two turned themselves in to authorities later that night.
In [[Eidsvåg, Nesset|Eidsvåg]], a sighting was reported at a petrol station.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thelocal.no/20161012/creepy-clown-craze-puts-norwegians-on-edge|title=Creepy clown craze puts Norwegians on edge|publisher=''[[The Local]]''|date=October 12, 2016}}</ref>
===Singapore=== On October 29, a 19-year-old man filmed himself dressed up as a creepy clown and jumping out towards people. The next day, the man was detained by [[Singapore Police]] at his home and taken to a police station for questioning for several hours. It was the first known and only reported clown scare incident in [[Asia]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Hale, Erin|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/erinhale/2016/11/03/creepy-clowns-arrive-in-asia-as-singapore-prank-ends-in-hours-of-police-detention/#6f9177af3903|title=Creepy Clowns Arrive In Asia As Singapore Prank Ends In Hours Of Police Detention |publisher=''[[Forbes]]''|date=November 3, 2016}}</ref>
===Spain=== In mid-October, a person dressed as a creepy clown was filmed standing near a road in [[Lleida]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telecinco.es/informativos/moda-payasos-diabolicos-llegado-Espana_2_2260680063.html|title=Diabolical clowns fad has come to Spain|publisher=''[[Telecinco]]''|date=October 16, 2016}}</ref>
Also, some sightings were reported in [[Paterna]] ([[Valencian Community]]). The City Council called for calm and issued guidelines for neighbors to know how to act.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.20minutos.es/noticia/2870758/0/payasos-terrorificos-llegan-calles-espanolas/|title=Diabolical clowns come to Spain's streets|publisher=''20 minutos''|date=October 24, 2016}}</ref>
On October 28, a case was reported in [[Madrid Metro]], in [[Loranca (Madrid Metro)|Loranca Station]] ([[Fuenlabrada]]), when a young girl was assailed by two people dressed as clowns.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.madridiario.es/noticia/438353/municipios/dos-payasos-diabolicos-asaltan-a-una-joven-en-fuenlabrada.html|title=Two evil clowns assailed a girl in Fuenlabrada|publisher=''Madridiario''|date=October 28, 2016}}</ref>
===Sweden=== Since the week starting October 10, sightings have been reported in numerous cities: [[Stockholm]], [[Malmö]], [[Timrå]], [[Ronneby]], [[Linköping]], [[Mjölby]], and [[Falun]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.expressen.se/nyheter/7-fragor-och-svar-om-clownerna-i-sverige/ |title=7 frågor och svar om clownerna i Sverige |newspaper=[[Expressen]] |date=October 13, 2016 |first=Pär |last=Ullrich |language=Swedish |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161014065346/http://www.expressen.se/nyheter/7-fragor-och-svar-om-clownerna-i-sverige/ |archivedate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 12, a person in the clown mask stabbed a 19-year-old boy with a knife in his shoulder in [[Tvååker]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deutsch.rt.com/newsticker/41972-grusel-clowns-jetzt-in-schweden/|title=Grusel-Clowns - jetzt in Schweden: Junger Mann niedergestochen |publisher=''[[RT Deutsch]]''|date=October 14, 2016}}</ref>
On October 13, a woman in [[Skänninge]] reported that she was threatened by a pair of clowns armed with knives.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thelocal.se/20161013/armed-clowns-threaten-woman-in-sweden|title=Armed clowns threaten woman in Sweden|publisher=''[[The Local]]''|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref> The following day, a man in [[Varberg]] was injured by a knifeman wearing a clown mask.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thelocal.se/20161014/teen-injured-in-clown-craze-attack-in-sweden |title=Teen injured in clown craze attack in Sweden |publisher=''[[The Local]]''|date=October 14, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://omni.se/knivskars-av-man-i-clownmask-ingen-gripen/a/XA0l7 |title=Knivskars av man i clownmask – ingen gripen |language=Swedish |publisher=Omni |date=October 14, 2016}}</ref><ref name="Lovejoy">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/16/opinion/sunday/what-do-the-scary-clowns-want.html|title=What Do the Scary Clowns Want?|author=Lovejoy, Bess|date=2016-10-15|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''}}</ref>
By mid-October, [[Swedish Police Authority|Swedish police]] were reportedly "overwhelmed" as a result of emergency calls due to clown sightings and incidents taking place across the country. On October 13, Swedish Interior Minister, [[Anders Ygeman]], urged Swedes not to join in the clown craze.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thelocal.se/20161015/sweden-police-overwhelmed-by-clown-emergency|title=Sweden police overwhelmed by clown emergency calls|date=15 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref>
===Switzerland=== In the third week of October, at least three sightings were reported in [[Zürich]]. One was reported to be violent, in which a person wearing a clown mask punched a person in the stomach.<ref>{{cite web|title='Scary clown' craze hits streets of Zurich|url=https://www.thelocal.ch/20161024/scary-clown-craze-hits-streets-of-zurich|publisher=[[The Local]]|date=October 24, 2016}}</ref>
===United Kingdom===
====England==== [[Northumbria Police]] stated that 6 reports have been made about clown incidents since the beginning of October. Although nobody was attacked during those incidents, some of the reports involve clowns in [[Newcastle upon Tyne]] jumping out of bushes to frighten children with other reports of clowns chasing people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/clownageddon-comes-uk-newcastle-schoolchildren-targetted-by-creepy-clown-attacks-1584809|title=Clownageddon comes to the UK as Newcastle schoolchildren targeted by 'creepy clown' attacks|first=Tom|last=Porter|date=4 October 2016|work=International Business Times UK|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/children-distressed-clowns-leaping-undergrowth-11978977|title=Children 'distressed' by 'pranksters' in clown costumes|first=Hannah|last=Graham|date=4 October 2016|work=chroniclelive.co.uk|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref> On October 4, a teenage boy in [[Blakelaw]], Newcastle upon Tyne, was placed under arrest as a suspect in a clown-themed "prank".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/clown-prank-teenager-arrested-allegedly-11980153|title=Clown prank: teenager arrested for allegedly carrying a "bladed article"|first=Hannah|last=Graham|date=4 October 2016|work=chroniclelive.co.uk|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 7, a masked man with a painted face and carrying a knife, jumped out and chased two students, aged 11 and 12, who were on their way to [[The Hermitage Academy|Hermitage Academy]] in [[Chester-le-Street]], [[County Durham]], leaving the two students distressed, but unhurt. [[Durham Constabulary]] said it was investigating the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/oct/07/knife-wielding-killer-clown-pursues-durham-schoolchildren|title=Knife-wielding 'killer clown' pursues Durham schoolchildren|agency=Press Association|date=7 October 2016|work=The Guardian}}</ref> That same night, a man in [[Plymouth]], [[South West England]], was confronted by a clown with a hammer while walking home from a [[Tesco]] supermarket. The clown stood in front of the man, blocking his path and then refused to move when asked, before the man chased the clown away. [[Devon and Cornwall Police]] were investigating the incident.<ref>{{cite web|author=Shaw, Neil|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/creepy-clown-armed-hammer-confronts-9004945|title=Creepy clown armed with hammer confronts man – then gets chased down street with beer bottle|publisher=[[Mirror.co.uk]]|date=October 8, 2016}}</ref>
On October 9, a 30-year-old man dressed as a clown was arrested after chasing a woman through Eaton Park in [[Norwich]], [[East Anglia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.edp24.co.uk/news/crime/man_dressed_as_clown_arrested_in_norwich_after_chasing_woman_through_eaton_park_1_4729254|title=Man dressed as clown arrested in Norwich after chasing woman through Eaton Park|first=Jessica|last=Long|date=|work=edp24.co.uk}}</ref>
On October 10, a gang of three people dressed as clowns were spotted in [[Welwyn Garden City]], [[Hertfordshire]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whtimes.co.uk/news/herts_police_issues_warning_over_frightening_clowns_1_4728964 |title=Herts Police issues warning over 'frightening' clowns |first=Nina |last=Morgan |date= |work=Welwyn Hatfield Times}}</ref> [[Kent Police]] reported there had been 59 clown-related incidents between October 7 and 10.<ref>{{cite web|last=Armstrong |first=Jeremy |url=http://www.irishmirror.ie/news/weird-news/killer-clowns-leave-children-terrified-9041714 |title=Killer clowns leave children so terrified they're calling Childline in their hundreds – Irish Mirror Online |website=Irish Mirror |date=2016-10-13 |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> On 11 October a teenage boy was hospitalized for a cut to his head after a clown threw a [[Trunk (botany)|log]] at him in an alleyway in [[Dinnington, South Yorkshire]], near [[Rotherham]]. [[South Yorkshire Police]] launched an investigation into the attack.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-37634853|title=Boy injured in clown craze attack in Rotherham|date=12 October 2016|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
On October 12, a tradesman in [[Blackburn]], Lancashire apparently tackled a knife-wielding man dressed as a clown and suffered serious hand injuries. The clown was said to have had a green wig and was wearing a "silky green tracksuit with yellow lines down the sleeves and long, Gothic black boots."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-lancashire-37629718|title='Knife-wielding clown' leaves man with serious hand injuries|date=12 October 2016|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> It was later revealed to be a hoax – the man had simply fallen on broken glass and fabricated the clown attack. He was prosecuted for wasting the time of [[Lancashire Police]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Christodoulou|first1=Holly|title=CLOWNING AROUND: A dad who said he was 'disabled for life' by a killer clown has been slapped with a fine for making it up|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/news/1972641/a-dad-who-said-he-was-disabled-for-life-by-a-killer-clown-has-been-slapped-with-a-fine-for-making-it-up/|website=The Sun}}</ref>
Over a weekend, in mid-October, the [[Thames Valley Police]] were called to 14 incidents in less than 24 hours.<ref name="Thames Valley Police">{{cite news |date=October 2016 |title=Clown sightings in the UK – where have they been spotted and where has the trend come from|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/1929560/killer-clown-sightings-uk-where-why/ |work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]}}</ref>
====Scotland==== According to [[Police Scotland]], there have been several reports about people dressed as clowns intimidating the public.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/local-news/clown-creeps-warned-over-conduct-9030259|title=Clown creeps warned over conduct after reports of intimidation in Livingston |work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]|date=12 October 2016|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
A former ''[[The X Factor (UK TV series)|X Factor]]'' contestant claimed to be chased by a "killer clown" in possession of a baseball bat outside a nightclub in [[Aberdeen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/fp/news/aberdeen/1051496/x-factor-star-chased-killer-clown-outside-aberdeen-nightclub/|title=X Factor star 'chased by "killer clown" outside Aberdeen nightclub'|publisher=[[The Press and Journal (Scotland)|The Press and Journal]] |date=10 October 2016 |accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
"Killer clowns" sightings in [[Dunbar]] caused traffic jams and were apparently chasing after children. A clown was spotted and filmed crossing a road near the town's [[Asda]] supermarket.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/killer-clown-craze-arrives-in-scotland-1-4254918 |title='Killer clown' craze arrives in Scotland|publisher=[[The Scotsman]] |date=11 October 2016 |accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
"Killer clowns" have been jumping out of bushes to scare pedestrians in [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]] and [[Dundee]].<ref name="Scotland Courier">{{cite web|url=https://www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/news/local/perth-kinross/298765/killer-clown-craze-hits-perth-as-masked-man-bursts-from-trees-to-terrify-walker/|title="Killer clown" craze hits Perth as masked man bursts from trees to terrify walker|work=[[The Courier (Dundee)|The Courier]]|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
A man walking his dog spotted a "killer clown" near a primary school in [[Motherwell]]. The clown ran away after it was revealed that he is scared of dogs, as it is clear in the video that the man filmed.
10 year old children living in [[Inverness]] reported seeing a "killer clown" at a play park who was armed with an unknown weapon. One of the children ran home, leaving her scooter behind. Her older sister, along with her boyfriend, went back to the play park to get the scooter but it was gone, realising that the clown had stolen it.
On 27 October 2016, "killer clowns" were spotted at two schools in [[Livingston, West Lothian|Livingston]] and one school in [[Bathgate]]. Pupils at schools in Livingston were locked into classrooms, fearing a break-in from the clowns.
====Wales==== On October 5, a boy filmed a person dressed as a clown scaring passing drivers in [[Caernarfon]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Jones, Dion|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/terrified-boy-films-creepy-clown-8988638|title=Terrified boy films creepy clown spooking drivers near children's play centre in quiet Welsh town|publisher=[[Mirror.co.uk]]|date=October 6, 2016}}</ref>
On October 7, a 10-year-old schoolboy in [[Tredegar]], South Wales was left with a large bruise after a stone was thrown at him by someone dressed in a clown costume.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.southwalesargus.co.uk/news/14792761.Boy_injured_after_being_chased_by__stone_throwing__clown_as_police_warn__over__killer_clown__incidents/|title=Boy injured after being chased by 'stone-throwing' clown as police warn over 'killer clown' incidents|publisher=}}</ref> A person dressed as a clown who was seen frightening people in the street in [[Rhyl]], who was stopped by police, was revealed to be a wanted man, and another person dressed as a clown was also seen in [[Merthyr Tydfil|Merthyr]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/clown-unmasked-police-turns-out-12003455|title='Clown' unmasked by police turns out to be a wanted man|date=10 October 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
On October 10, a girl aged 10 in [[Bridgend]] was left scared when four people, wearing clown masks and carrying a "[[sledgehammer]]", approached her in a park.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/girl-aged-10-left-scared-12009925|title=Four clowns carrying a 'sledgehammer' approached girl in a park|first=Abby|last=Bolter|date=11 October 2016|publisher=}}</ref> That same night, Chief Inspector Paul Staniforth of [[Gwent Police]] said: "We've now received 18 reports of people dressed up as clowns throughout Gwent. Some of the reports have included clowns running through gardens and peering through windows, lurking around shopping centres, parks and schools and jumping from trees."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/clowns-running-through-gardens-peering-12004301|title=Clowns 'running through gardens and peering through windows'|first=Huw|last=Silk|date=10 October 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
====Northern Ireland==== On October 5, a number of people dressed as clowns were spotted in [[Belfast]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.belfastvibe.com/big-stories/belfast/killer-clowns-have-been-spotted-in-belfast-people-are-quite-rightly-freaking-out/ |title='Killer Clowns' Have Been Spotted In Belfast & People Are (Quite Rightly) Freaking Out |website=Belfastvibe.com |date= |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> On October 7, a school in [[Coleraine]] had closed its doors for a short time because of fears that people dressed as clowns were on their way to the school.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-37591036 |title='Killer clown' warning as craze hits Northern Ireland |publisher=BBC |date=7 October 2016}}</ref> On 7 October a clown threatened children with a knife in Riverside Park, Ballymoney, [[County Antrim]]. On Instagram an account called 'killerclownsballymoney' said a clown would be "waiting at Ballymoney High school gates at 3:55 and on Mondays it'll be Dalriada at 2:40".<ref>{{cite web|author=Daire Courtney |url=http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/children-threatened-with-knife-by-killer-clown-in-antrim-park-35117880.html |title=Children threatened with knife by 'killer clown' in Antrim park |website=Independent.ie |date= |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> On social media, an image appeared of a clown stood outside Cullybackey College in the village of [[Cullybackey]]<ref name="irishmirror1">{{cite web|last=Kilpatrick |first=Chris |url=http://www.irishmirror.ie/news/irish-news/primary-school-goes-lockdown-after-9033261 |title=Irish school goes into lockdown after sinister threat online from killer clowns – Irish Mirror Online |website=Irishmirror.ie |date=2016-10-12 |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> The police released a video in which they urged people not to participate in the craze and said they faced the possibility of being arrested.<ref>{{cite news|author=Suzanne McGonagle |url=http://www.irishnews.com/news/northernirelandnews/2016/10/14/news/psni-issue-killer-clown-warning-to-the-public-736788/ |title=Video: PSNI issue 'killer clown' warning to the public |newspaper=[[The Irish News]] |date= |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> On October 12, Holy Trinity College, Cookstown, [[County Tyrone]] was locked down after a threat on social media, police officers were deployed to the school and the front gate was closed. [[Ulster Unionist Party|UUP]] politician [[Trevor Wilson (politician)|Trevor Wilson]] condemned the threat.<ref name="irishmirror1"/> By mid October 10 children had received [[NSPCC]] counselling over fears of the clowns.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kilpatrick |first=Chris |url=http://www.belfastlive.co.uk/news/killer-clowns-terror-sparks-surge-12022248 |title=Killer clowns terror sparks surge in counselling calls to NSPCC kids' charity |publisher=Belfast Live |date=2016-10-14 |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> A school in [[Ballycastle, County Antrim]] banned the wearing of clown costumes to a Halloween party taking place during school.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/northern-ireland/northern-ireland-school-bans-killer-clowns-from-halloween-party-35164744.html|title=Northern Ireland school bans killer clowns from Halloween party|date=|work=belfasttelegraph.co.uk|accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref> Three people dressed as clowns were arrested by police after they scared people in Mullacreevie Park, [[County Armagh]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.belfastlive.co.uk/news/common-assault-northern-ireland-park-12052778|title=Killer clowns accused of common assault in Northern Ireland estate|first=Chris|last=Kilpatrick|date=20 October 2016|work=belfastlive.co.uk|accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref>
===United States=== <!--this is [[WP:REFBOMB]]ing for a single sentence. Use only what is required.--> After originally occurring in [[South Carolina]], the sightings and threats spread to more than four-fifths of the country's states, the [[District of Columbia]], and the territory of [[Puerto Rico]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://heavy.com/news/2016/09/clown-sightings-list-which-states-cities-have-creepy-threatening-clowns-ohio-carolina-wisconsin-florida-arrests-who-where/|title=Clown Sightings List: Which States Have Reported Threatening Clowns?|first=Stephanie Dube|last=Dwilson|date=1 October 2016|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stltoday.com/news/local/metro/as-reports-trickle-in-of-creepy-clown-sightings-pevely-police/article_f5b45685-18df-5005-8bd8-7637506d1cbb.html|title=As reports trickle in of creepy clown sightings, Pevely police worry about vigilantes|last=Bell|first=Kim|access-date=2016-10-01}}</ref>
====Alabama==== In the second and third weeks of September, a total of 9 people were arrested across Alabama for threats. Seven of them faced felony charges. A 14-year-old was arrested for a misdemeanor charge for threatening Rainbow Middle School in [[Rainbow City, Alabama|Rainbow City]]. Two teenage juveniles were arrested in [[Calhoun County, Alabama|Calhoun County]], one for making threats to shoot up a [[Saks, Alabama|Saks]] middle school, and the other for a charge of "child in need of supervision." In [[Escambia County, Alabama|Escambia County]], a 22-year-old woman and two juveniles were arrested on terroristic threat charges for a September 15 threat against a school.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/news/birmingham/index.ssf/2016/09/nine_clown_arrests_so_far_in_a.html|title=At least 9 'clown' arrests in Alabama|publisher=al.com}}</ref>
====Alaska==== On October 8 and 9, a woman posted on [[Facebook]] that her daughter saw a clown near Floyd Dryden Middle School in [[Juneau]] and that on the night of October 10, her co-worker was chased while in her car by two clowns who were holding metal objects.<ref>{{cite web|author=DeGrave, Sam|url=http://juneauempire.com/local/2016-10-11/creepy-clown-sightings-reported-juneau|title=Creepy clown sightings reported in Juneau|publisher=''[[Juneau Empire]]''|date=October 11, 2016}}</ref>
====Arizona==== Two 17-year-olds robbed a [[Phoenix, Arizona|Phoenix]] [[Taco Bell]] and [[Domino's Pizza]] while wearing clown masks. Both of the alleged robbers were armed with weapons, and a gun was fired once during one of the robberies,{{which|date=October 2016}} but no one was injured. The two were arrested for robbery.<ref name="phoenix">{{cite web|url=http://nbc4i.com/2016/09/30/teens-arrested-after-multiple-clown-mask-robberies/|date=2016-09-30|title=Teens arrested after multiple clown mask robberies|publisher=[[WCMH-TV]]}}</ref>
====Arkansas==== People dressed as clowns were reported in [[Lowell, Arkansas|Lowell]] near the elementary schools. A person dressed as a clown was arrested in [[Downtown Bentonville]], Arkansas on October 5, 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.4029tv.com/news/Bentonville-police-arrest-scary-clown/41978036 |title=Bentonville police arrest scary clown |date=5 October 2016}}</ref>
====California==== On October 4, people dressed as clowns threatened [[Fairfield, California|Fairfield]], [[Sacramento]], and [[Vallejo, California|Vallejo]] public school campuses.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/Twitter-Threats-From-Clowns-Span-From-Fairfield-California-to-Fairfield-Connecticut-395845791.html|title=Clowns Threaten Fairfield, Oakland Schools on Twitter|publisher=[[NBC Bay Area]]|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=October 5, 2016}}</ref><ref name="KCRA">{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/news/local-news/news-sacramento/threats-of-creepy-clowns-plague-sacramentoarea-schools/41951634|title=Threats of 'creepy clowns' plague Sacramento-area schools|publisher=[[KCRA]]|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref> A clown sighting was reported in [[Temecula, CA|Temecula]].<ref name="abc7fontana"/>
On October 5, a person dressed as a clown was accused of trying to kidnap a 1-year-old child from his mother in [[Concord, CA|Concord]]. No arrests have been made.<ref name="concord">{{cite web|url=http://abc7news.com/news/clown-accused-of-attempting-to-kidnap-child-in-concord/1540861/|title=Clown accused of attempting to kidnap child in Concord|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref>
That same night, in the [[Los Angeles County]] city of [[Lancaster, CA|Lancaster]], three incidents of groups of people wearing clown masks and possibly armed with kitchen knives were reported to the police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxla.com/news/local-news/209764735-story|title='Creepy clowns' come to SoCal, police warn residents|publisher=[[FOX LA]]}}</ref> In [[San Pedro, Los Angeles]], two clowns were spotted by employees at Taper Avenue Elementary School & Technology Magnet. One clown allegedly had the writing "killer" printed on his mask.<ref>{{cite web|author=Salvo, Christina|url=http://abc7.com/news/2-dressed-as-clowns-creep-up-on-san-pedro-school-workers/1540272/|title=2 DRESSED AS CLOWNS CREEP UP ON SAN PEDRO ELEMENTARY SCHOOL WORKERS|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref> In [[Northridge, Los Angeles|Northridge]], Los Angeles, at [[California State University, Northridge]], two students were chased down by a lone clown in the campus.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sundial.csun.edu/2016/10/students-react-to-recent-clown-sighting-on-campus/|title=Students react to recent clown sighting on campus|last=Cruz|first=Glory Rose|date=2016-10-06|newspaper=The Sundial|language=English|access-date=2016-10-07}}</ref>
A 14-year-old from [[Fontana, California|Fontana]] was arrested for making clown-related threats towards schools.<ref name="abc7fontana">{{cite web|url=http://abc7.com/news/teen-arrested-for-fontana-killer-clown-scare-on-social-media/1541219/|title=TEEN ARRESTED FOR 'FONTANA KILLER CLOWN' SCARE ON SOCIAL MEDIA|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
On October 6, people dressed as clowns were spotted at multiple schools including ones in [[Moreno Valley]], Sacramento, and [[Beaumont, CA|Beaumont]]. One clown allegedly walked around the school campus with a sign that read "WEARECOMINGTOCALI." The Huntington Beach Police Department received reports of two separate clown sightings in [[Huntington Beach]]: one near a community park and two near a shopping center.<ref>{{cite web|title='Creepy clown' sightings hit Orange County; two reported in Huntington Beach|url=http://www.ocregister.com/articles/reported-731196-police-clowns.html|publisher=[[OC Register]]|date=October 6, 2016}}</ref>
On the same day, the [[Rohnert Park]] Department of Public Safety launched an investigation in response to nine clown sightings being reported in the city in the past few days. In nearby [[Santa Rosa, CA|Santa Rosa]], the [[Santa Rosa City Schools]] worked with the [[Santa Rosa Police Department]] to investigate clown-related threats made to the district's schools, which were apparently hoaxes.<ref name="morrisjd">{{cite web|author=Morris, J.D.|url=http://www.pressdemocrat.com/news/6171472-181/creepy-clown-threats-lead-to|title="Creepy clown" threats lead to investigations in Sonoma County|publisher=''[[Press Democrat]]''|date=October 7, 2016}}</ref> Social media reports of potential clown-related activity in the [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]]'s [[Antioch, CA|Antioch]] and [[Oakland, CA|Oakland]] schools lead to investigations by city police investigations.<ref name="morrisjd"/> Schools in [[Pittsburg, CA|Pittsburg]] banned students from wearing any makeup for Halloween due to the clown scare.
The [[Marysville, California|Marysville]] police arrested a juvenile on a felony charge for making clown-related threats of shooting people at [[Yuba County]] schools.<ref>{{cite web|author=Heise, Sarah|url=http://www.kcra.com/news/local-news/news-sacramento/marysville-police-make-clown-arrest-after-threats/42005196|title=Marysville police make 'clown' arrest after threats|publisher=[[KCRA]]|date=October 7, 2016}}</ref>
An 11-year-old boy from [[Salinas, California|Salinas]] was cited for [[cyberbullying]] on October 8 for making clown threats towards Alisal Elementary School District schools.<ref>{{cite web|author=Cabanatuan, Michael|url=http://www.sfgate.com/crime/article/Salinas-boy-11-cited-after-admitting-making-9958361.php|title=Salinas boy, 11, cited after admitting making creepy clown threats|publisher=''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]''|date=October 9, 2016}}</ref>
On October 10, a "creepy clown" was spotted and photographed on a [[MUNI]] bus in [[San Francisco]]; the clown flipped off the photographer after she took the photo.<ref>{{cite web|author=Rodriguez, Joe Fitzgerald |url=http://www.sfexaminer.com/creepy-clown-spotted-muni-bus-amid-nationwide-craze/|publisher=[[The San Francisco Examiner]]|title='Creepy clown' spotted on Muni bus amid nationwide craze|date=October 10, 2016}}</ref>
On October 16, a person dressed as a clown holding a knife approached a man sitting on his porch outside his house in [[Santa Clarita, CA|Santa Clarita]], and the home owner fired a gun in the air, scaring the clown. A person dressed as a clown was arrested by [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]] deputies for possession of burglary tools, although the department speculated that the clown arrested was not connected to the one who was holding the knife. The home owner was taken into custody after deputies found drugs and firearms in his home.<ref>{{citation|url=http://abc7.com/news/santa-clarita-creepy-clown-scared-off-after-man-fires-gun-into-air/1557975/|title=SANTA CLARITA CREEPY CLOWN SCARED OFF AFTER MAN FIRES GUN INTO AIR|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=October 16, 2016}}</ref>
On October 23, three men were initially reported to be wearing clown masks and carrying a gun inside the [[Westfield San Francisco Centre]], although it was later reported that the three men were carrying the masks. Mall security reported that the clowns fled the scene after seeing them.<ref>{{cite web|author=De Guzman, Diana|url=http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Three-men-with-creepy-clown-masks-and-a-gun-10155034.php|title=Reports: 3 men with 'creepy clown' masks, gun found by security at SF's Westfield mall|publisher=''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]''|date=October 24, 2016}}</ref>
On October 23, sightings of a suspect dressed as a clown in UC Davis's West Village Apartment complex were reported to the police. Media coverage and police bulletins publicized the suspect as wielding an unidentifiable weapon and harassing residents.
====Colorado==== On September 30, in [[Denver]], a student reported to the police that a person dressed as a clown grabbed her.<ref name="contrerashernandez">{{cite web|author1=Contreras, Oscar |author2=Hernandez, Lance |url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/front-range/where-creepy-clowns-have-been-reported-across-colorado|title=Where creepy clowns have been reported across Colorado|publisher=[[The Denver Channel]]|date=October 1, 2016}}</ref>
In late September, clown-related threats of violence were made to [[Jefferson County Public Schools (Colorado)|Jefferson County School District]], [[Poudre High School]], [[Palisade High School]], [[Grand Junction High School]], [[Northridge High School (Colorado)|Northridge High School]].<ref name="contrerashernandez"/>
On October 6, an altercation occurred between a clown and a man at the Pikes Peak Greenway Trail in [[Colorado Springs]]. The man allegedly asked the clown to identify himself, who refused to do so, and the man punched the clown in the face. The clown then allegedly hit a bottle of [[whiskey]] over the man's head, resulting in him bleeding. No arrests have been made in the case.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dawidowicz, Christina|url=http://fox21news.com/2016/10/06/victim-describes-creepy-clown-attack-in-co-springs/|title=Victim describes creepy clown attack in Colorado Springs|publisher=[[FOX21 News]]|date=October 7, 2016|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref>
====Connecticut==== [[New Haven]] High schools, such as [[Eli Whitney Technical High School|Eli Whitney]], [[Wilbur Cross High School|Wilbur Cross]], [[Co-op High School|Co-Op]], and [[Hillhouse High School|James Hillhouse]], were threatened by "Jackson the Clown" on social media. Two girls were later arrested for the threats.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://wtnh.com/2016/10/04/naugatuck-police-arrest-2-girls-for-clown-social-media-posts/|title=Naugatuck police arrest 2 girls for clown social media posts|author=Macy Corica|date=October 4, 2016|work=WTNH Connecticut News|accessdate=8 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 13, [[New Britain High School]] was placed on lock down following a clown-related incident at the school. A 35-year-old woman and a 39-year-old man were arrested for a [[breach of peace]], and were driving in a car with clown masks and blaring loud music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ktla.com/2016/10/13/2-arrested-after-clown-causes-lockdown-at-connecticut-high-school/|title=2 Arrested in Connection With Clown Prank Resulting in Lockdown of Connecticut School|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref>
In October 2016, 2 juvenile girls in Naugatuck were charged in connection with making online threats involving "scary clowns".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wfsb.com/story/33309665/more-ct-schools-receive-threats-involving-clowns-2-girls-charged-in-naugatuck|title=More CT schools receive threats involving clowns; 2 girls charged in Naugatuck|last=Campbell|first=Julien Novog-Desrayaud, Rob Polansky, Evan White, Matt|access-date=2017-08-04|language=en}}</ref>
Also in October 2016, Meriden saw a rash of scary clown sightings and incidents.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wfsb.com/story/33327310/meriden-officials-continue-to-investigate-creepy-clown-sightings|title=Meriden officials continue to investigate creepy clown sightings|last=Naples|first=Matt McFarland, Kaitlyn|access-date=2017-08-04|language=en}}</ref>
====Delaware==== The Delaware State Police and [[University of Delaware]] Police received reports of clown sightings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/crime/2016/10/03/delaware-clown-sightings/91463920/ |title=Clown sightings in Delaware freak out moms, students|date=October 3, 2016}}</ref>
Two high school students in [[Smyrna, Delaware|Smyrna]] were arrested and charged with felony terroristic threatening and conspiracy after making threats of clowns committing violence against other students on [[Instagram]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/crime/2016/10/05/2-delaware-teens-arrested-threat-clown-attack-bombs/91640818/|title=2 Delaware teens arrested for threat of clown attack, bombs|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref> The high school was evacuated and an explosive detection K9 team swept and cleared the building.
====Florida==== Numerous reports of sightings have been received by the Indian River County Sheriff's Office. In [[Indian River County]], on September 28, while walking her dog, a woman reported seeing a person in a clown costume come out from behind a tree. The person was dressed in a white clown costume, wore a mask, and had red hair.<ref name="lohud.com"/>
On September 28, a group of classmates in the [[Vero Lake Estates]] area were chased by someone in a clown mask after getting off a bus.<ref name="lohud.com"/>
A woman near Victoria Park reported sighting two people dressed as clowns staring at her. Police alerted agencies in the surrounding area. They also conducted a search of railroad tracks and forest areas near U.S. highway 1, but were unable to find them.<ref name="lohud.com"/>
Numerous Floridian schools were also put under lock down due to the scare.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://hudsonvalley.news12.com/news/clown-scares-lock-down-village-of-florida-schools-1.12405382|title=Clown scares lock down village of Florida schools|publisher=[[News 12 Networks]] (Hudson Valley channel)|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.recordonline.com/news/20161004/local-school-locked-down-after-reports-of-clown-inside-school|title=Local school locked down after reports of clown inside the school|publisher=[[Times Herald-Record]]|author=Michael Randall|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref> Additionally, threats arose on social media from people masquerading as clowns, where they threaten to cause a [[school shooting]]. One of these "killer clowns" was discovered to be a 12-year-old boy, who said he was going to kill students at Pasco County schools and was subsequently arrested.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.palmbeachpost.com/news/news/crime-law/deputies-12-year-old-arrested-clown-threats-florid/nskpm/|title=Deputies: 12-year-old arrested for clown threats to Florida schools|publisher=[[The Palm Beach Post]]|author=Zach Dennis|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.palmbeachpost.com/news/news/crime-law/deputies-12-year-old-arrested-clown-threats-florid/nskpm/|title=Deputies: 12-year-old arrested for clown threats to Florida...|access-date=2016-10-07}}</ref>
On October 15, two men, ages 18 and 20, were involved in two incidents in [[Melbourne, Florida|Melbourne]] where they dressed as clowns and chased people while carrying an ax and a baseball bat.
