They were also involved with a third incident on October 20. In one of the incidents, one of the clowns was reported to have jumped in front of a person and threaten to kill him or her. On October 27, they were arrested and one was charged with assault and the other was charged with principal in the first degree.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wesh.com/article/2-men-dressed-as-clowns-chase-people-around-north-melbourne-police-say/7663868|title=2 men dressed as clowns chase people around north Melbourne, police say|publisher=[[WESH]]|date=October 27, 2016}}</ref>
On October 23, a 26-year-old [[Mount Dora, Florida|Mount Dora]] man was arrested for illegally possessing a rifle with a scratched out serial number. The man had a clown mask, and ran from Lake County deputies, which resulted in a physical altercation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/lake/os-leesburg-clown-arrest-20161026-story.html|title=Lake deputies arrest armed felon with clown mask|author=Cherney, Elyssa|publisher=''[[Orlando Sentinel]]|date=October 26, 2016}}</ref>
Some parents said they would be arming themselves on Halloween night to protect their children.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox25boston.com/news/trending-now/some-florida-parents-arm-themselves-against-creepy-clowns-on-halloween/462581635|title=Some Florida parents arm themselves against 'creepy clowns' on Halloween|last=EndPlay|date=1 November 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
On Halloween night, a group of about 20 people in clown masks and masks from the movie ''[[The Purge]]'', allegedly attacked two people who were checking their cars in [[Orange County, Florida|Orange County]]. One man was stabbed and injured, and another was assaulted with a hockey stick.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/local/victim-recognizes-teen-during-brutal-attack-by-20-people-in-the-purge-clown-masks/462664786|title=Victim recognizes teen during brutal attack by 20 people in 'The Purge,' clown masks |publisher=[[WFTV]]|date=November 1, 2016}}</ref>
====Georgia==== The [[LaGrange, Georgia|LaGrange]] Police Department received reports of people dressed as clowns in a van luring children on September 12.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/lagrangepolicedept/posts/1388028421224814?match=Y2xvd25z|title=LaGrange Police – Timeline {{!}} Facebook|website=www.facebook.com|access-date=2016-10-01}}</ref> Two people were later arrested for falsely reporting a clown sighting, and four were arrested for making a "terroristic threat" involving clown costumes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.11alive.com/news/local/ga-cops-make-terroristic-threat-arrests-after-clown-post/321945608|title=Ga. cops make 'terroristic threat' arrests after clown post|author=Kristen Reed|author2=Kaitlyn Ross|date=September 20, 2016|publisher=TEGNA|language=English|access-date=2016-10-01}}</ref> Dublin Police Chief Tim Chatman stated that an individual involved in a car accident reported seeing a clown and swerved to avoid the clown, although no one saw a clown at the time of the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.11alive.com/news/local/police-no-evidence-of-scary-clown-sightings-in-dublin/317881438 |title=Creepy clowns in Dublin?|author=Madison Cavalchire |date=12 September 2016}}</ref>
====Hawaii==== On October 6, an [[Instagram]] post by a group of people dressed as clowns threatened violence to Wai'anae Intermediate, a school in [[Waianae, Hawaii|Wai'anae]]. The [[Schofield Barracks|U.S. Army Garrison-Hawaii]] was also involved.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/story/33338335/clown-hysteria-hits-hawaii-prompting-security-fears|title=Clown hysteria hits Hawaii, prompting security fears|author=Rick Daysog|date=7 October 2016|publisher=hawaiinewsnow.com|accessdate=12 October 2016}}</ref>
====Idaho==== In early October, reports of people dressed as clowns walking around school campuses and around streets, some armed with metal weapons, were made in eastern Idaho, including [[Blackfoot, Idaho|Blackfoot]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Bryce, Debbie|url=http://idahostatejournal.com/members/creepy-clown-craze-infecting-east-idaho/article_783baa90-29a3-5e8d-b00b-79e843db38f8.html|title=Creepy clown craze infecting East Idaho|publisher=''[[Idaho State Journal]]''|date=October 9, 2016}}</ref>
====Illinois==== On October 4, multiple students at Greenwood Elementary School reported that three people dressed as clowns, one with a briefcase, one with a handgun, and one with a knife, stood on the edge of the school's property and threatened the students. The people dressed as clowns reportedly made threats to the students, and fled in an [[SUV]]. The incident is being investigated by the Waukegan Police Department.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox32chicago.com/news/crime/209628617-story|title=Waukegan Police investigating after 3 clowns with knife and gun taunt children during recess|publisher=[[FOX32 Chicago]]|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=October 6, 2016}}</ref> A call to the Waukegan Police Department responded in a report that the children were found out to have made it up.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/clown-sighting-at-greenwood-elementary-school-in-waukegan/|title=Cops: Clown sighting at Waukegan elementary was fake|publisher=}}</ref>
On October 5, a 20-year-old man in [[Altamont, Illinois]] was arrested for disorderly conduct allegedly wearing a clown mask and holding a chainsaw, scaring a woman and child.<ref>{{cite web|author=Grimes, Bill|url=http://www.effinghamdailynews.com/news/local_news/man-dressed-as-clown-arrested-in-altamont/article_f55105db-c60f-5487-af76-5407c62aba04.html|title=Man dressed as clown arrested in Altamont|publisher=''[[Effingham Daily News]]''|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
====Iowa==== On October 11, an 18-year-old man with a clown mask was arrested for allegedly chasing two people with a metal baseball bat in [[Urbandale, Iowa|Urbandale]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/crime-and-courts/2016/10/11/man-dressed-clown-arrested-assault-urbandale/91914496/|title=Man dressed as clown arrested for assault in Urbandale|publisher=''[[Des Moines Register]]''}}</ref>
====Kansas==== On September 27, 2016, a person dressed as a clown was spotted creeping in the bushes near the intersection of 85th Street and [[Parallel Parkway]] in [[Kansas City, Kansas]].
On October 1, 2016, in [[Topeka, Kansas|Topeka]], a clown was spotted near the intersection of Southeast 37th Street and Southeast Adams Street. Again in Topeka, a few days later on the morning of October 4, 2016, children waiting at a bus stop in the 2400 block of Southeast Colonial Drive witnessed a clown with a knife chasing a 13-year-old girl; however, by the time police arrived, the clown disappeared and was not seen again.
During the day of October 4, in nearby [[Lawrence, Kansas|Lawrence]] several people reported seeing clowns lurking around the [[University of Kansas]] campus, with many witnesses posting photos to social media. The clown sightings caused one [[Fraternities and sororities|sorority]] to go into [[lockdown]]. People dressed as clowns were also spotted in Lawrence near [[Lawrence Free State High School|Free State High School]], however upon investigation, those clowns were found to be harmless and were merely waving at passing cars. Reports of clowns have also been made in the Kansas cities of [[Chanute, Kansas|Chanute]], [[Pittsburg, Kansas|Pittsburg]], and [[Parsons, Kansas|Parsons]]; however the Parsons report was later revealed to be a [[hoax]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.parsonssun.com/news/article_e1c53770-89df-11e6-9270-778ddc95c3a3.html|title=Clown report was a hoax|date=2016-10-03|publisher=''Parsons Sun''}}</ref>
====Kentucky==== On September 23, 20-year-old Jonathan Martin was arrested for wearing a hood or mask in a public place, disorderly conduct and two outstanding warrants for non-payment of fines and failure to appear in court. Martin was found in a full clown costume, lurking in wooded area near a Kentucky apartment block.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/23/lurking-clown-arrested-in-kentucky-woods-near-apartment-block-as/ |title=Lurking clown arrested in Kentucky woods near apartment block as US 'creepy clown' fears spread |date=23 September 2016 |publisher=The Telegraph}}</ref>
On October 1, a woman reported that while she was walking on a trail at night, a clown came out of the woods, assaulted her and attempted to drag her into the woods. Officials reported that the woman was able to fight the clown off and escape, while also stating that this is the first clown sighting in Clark County.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wdrb.com/story/33293981/police-woman-attacked-by-man-in-clown-mask-in-winchester-ky |title=Police investigating report of a woman attacked by man in clown mask in Winchester, Ky. |date=1 October 2016 |publisher=WDRB 41 Louisville}}</ref>
On the same day, a man in [[Bardstown, Kentucky|Bardstown]] mistook a woman wearing a white afghan out walking her dog for a clown and fired a warning shot with an [[Colt AR-15|AR-15]] to scare her.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/man-fires-ar15-dogwalker-creepy-clowns_us_57f53919e4b002a731201ef8|title=Man Allegedly Fires AR-15 To Scare Dogwalker He Mistook For Clown|author= Hilary Hanson|date=5 October 2016|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=8 October 2016}}</ref>
Throughout the month of September police received multiple reports of "creepy clown" in both Bowling Green and [[Glasgow, Kentucky|Glasgow]].
In late September in Louisville there were multiple reports to police stating that 5 to 6 people wearing clown costumes were sighted cruising around the downtown area at night in a white van.
====Louisiana==== On October 15, a 21-year-old man was arrested after an incident in [[Rosepine, Louisiana|Rosepine]] of him wearing a clown mask and brandishing a gun at drivers, while he was driving his car.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://klfy.com/2016/10/17/man-in-vernon-parish-arrested-for-wearing-clown-mask-holding-gun-inside-car/|title=Man in Vernon Parish arrested for wearing clown mask, holding gun inside car|publisher=[[KLFY]]|date=October 17, 2016}}</ref>
====Maine==== On October 4, a person dressed as a clown was reported to have stood in an [[Orono, Maine|Orono]] neighborhood for approximately 15 minutes.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wcsh6.com/news/local/police-to-clown-we-will-handle-you-accordingly/328814012|title=Police to clown: 'We will handle you accordingly'|author= Elle Ousfar |publisher=[[TEGNA]]|language=English|access-date=2016-10-04}}</ref> There have also been sightings in Standish, Bangor, Kennebunk, Gorham Porter, Portland, Saco, Waterboro and Wells.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wcyy.com/maines-clown-hysteria-reaches-new-heights-sightings-in-kennebunk-gorham-and-standish-reported/|title=Maine's Clown Hysteria Reaches New Heights; Sightings In Kennebunk, Gorham, and Standish Reported|author=Joey|date=October 5, 2016|work=wcyy.com}}</ref>
====Maryland==== In October, clown-themed accounts through different social media outlets began sending out threats to shoot [[Prince George's County Public Schools|PGCPS]] county schools.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Prince-Georges-County-to-Have-Additional-Officers-at-Schools-on-Monday-395589471.html |title=Student Charged in Md. School Threats Case |date=3 October 2016 |publisher=NBC Washignton}}</ref>
====Massachusetts==== On October 3, Monday night, students at [[Merrimack College]] were briefly told to shelter in place and a residence hall was evacuated after someone reported an armed clown on campus. Police at [[Emmanuel College (Massachusetts)|Emmanuel College]] received an “inundation of calls” of sightings on campus shortly after midnight Tuesday. A similar incident was reported at [[UMass Amherst]] the same Monday night, as well as additional reports in [[Lowell, Massachusetts|Lowell]] and other various localities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boston.cbslocal.com/2016/10/04/reported-creepy-clown-sightings-massachusetts-police-response/|title=Reported Creepy Clown Sightings At Mass. Schools Prompt Police Response|date=|work=cbslocal.com}}</ref>
====Michigan==== At 2:11 AM, on September 22, a person dressed as a clown was reported to police by a [[Vermontville, Michigan|Vermontville]] man. The clown was seen walking on M-79 highway in [[Nashville, Michigan|Nashville]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hastingsbanner.com/police-beat-p9522-92.htm|title=Police Beat / 9-29-16|website=hastingsbanner.com|access-date=2016-10-14}}</ref> At 6:30 am on October 4 Middle School Students waiting at a bus stop in [[Allegan County, Michigan|Allegan County, MI]] saw a clown emerge from a woods, run towards some other students, then disappear into the woods.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hastingsbanner.com/clown-reportedly-startles-student-p9566-87.htm|title=Clown reportedly startles student / 10-6-16|website=hastingsbanner.com|access-date=2016-10-14}}</ref> At 3 am in the early morning of October 2, 2016, 17-year-old Chris Henckel spotted a clown standing at a [[car wash]] in [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]], a suburb of [[Detroit]], while driving through the area with friends.<ref name="MI">{{cite news|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/macomb-county/2016/10/03/clown-siting-clinton-township/91508862/|title=Police probe alleged clown attacks in Sterling Heights|author=Candice Williams|date=5 October 2016|work=detroitnews.com|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref> While Henckel was not approached or harmed by the clown, he says that it attempted to follow his car.<ref name="MI" /> Henckel posted a video of the encounter on [[Twitter]], where it went viral.<ref name="MI" /> Clinton Township police declined to investigate the incident, as Henckel was unharmed and they have not received any reports or complaints of strange clowns in the area.<ref name="MI" /> Henckel said he drove by the carwash multiple times afterwards in an attempt to find the clown again, but it has not reappeared.<ref name="MI" />
Two days later, on October 4, 2016, two attacks were reported in [[Sterling Heights, Michigan|Sterling Heights]], another Detroit suburb in close vicinity to Clinton Township. In the first incident, a 7-year-old boy was approached outside of his home at 6:50 pm by a person of an unspecified gender with "red hair, a red nose and red facial features" wielding a sharp object; the clown scratched the boy's arm with the object then fled, the boy only suffering a minor injury.<ref name="MI"/> Later that night at 8:30 pm, two women walking reported being approached by three adult males in clown masks, one of which was wielding a [[baseball bat]], who screamed obscenities, hit the bat against an adjacent fence and then ran away.<ref name="MI"/> Sterling Heights police are investigating both incidents and are seeking help from the public.<ref name="MI"/> On the same day, the police department of the Detroit suburb of [[Troy, Michigan|Troy]], which borders Sterling Heights, issued a notice that any clowns spotted trespassing at schools or on any private property will be automatically arrested and detained.<ref name="Troy">{{cite news|url=http://detroit.cbslocal.com/2016/10/04/troy-police-post-stern-message-to-clowns-amid-sightings-scares-nationwide/|title=Troy Police Post Stern Message To Clowns Amid Sightings, Scares Nationwide|date=October 4, 2016|work=cbslocal.com}}</ref> The notice came after reports of clowns being spotted at area schools during classroom hours, as well as clown-related threats being made to area schools on Twitter.<ref name="Troy" /> They also stated concern for the safety of the clowns, who they fear could be harmed by frightened civilians who may attempt to defend themselves.<ref name="Troy" />
Also on October 6, two 14-year-old girls were terrorized by two teenage women dressed as clowns, who jumped out of a car and chased them. In a press release after their arrest, the [[Roseville, Michigan|Roseville]] police chief referred to them as "morons" and "idiots".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation-now/2016/10/07/police-2-idiots-dressed-creepy-clowns-arrested-after-terrorizing-teens/91732806/|title=Police: 2 'idiots' dressed as 'creepy clowns,' arrested after terrorizing teens|author=Christina Hall|date=October 7, 2016|publisher=USA Today}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox13news.com/news/210273947-story|title='Morons' in clown costumes arrested for trying to scare teens in Roseville|date=2016-10-07|publisher=[[WHBQ-TV]]}}</ref>
====Minnesota==== A 15-year-old girl from [[Bloomington, Minnesota|Bloomington]] created a "Kroacky Klown" [[Facebook]] profile and made threats to "kill" in Bloomington and other cities. After police interviewed the girl, she explained she created the profile on her younger sister's phone to scare her boyfriend but "the situation got out of control and went viral," police said.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.duluthnewstribune.com/news/4130282-creepy-clown-phenomenon-hitting-minnesota-no-truth-sightings-officials-say|title=Creepy clown phenomenon hitting Minnesota; no truth to sightings, officials say|author=Bob Shaw|date=Oct 5, 2016|work=duluthnewstribune.com|accessdate=8 October 2016}}</ref>
====Mississippi==== On September 21, in [[Tchula, Mississippi|Tchula]], Police Chief reported seeing a clown wearing a multi-colored wig, overalls, and a mask carrying what appeared to be a machete. Upon seeing the police car, the clown fled. His or her whereabouts remain unknown.<ref name="auto"/>
====Missouri==== One driver reported seeing a person dressed as a clown lurking around by Republic High School during the night in [[Republic, Missouri]].
People dressed as clowns have also been sighted in [[Platte City, Missouri|Platte City]], [[Joplin, Missouri|Joplin]] and [[Neosho, Missouri]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.koamtv.com/story/33307569/clown-craze-causing-concerns |title=Clown craze causing concerns |date=3 October 2016}}</ref> Clown related threats were also made in [[Blue Springs, Missouri]]. Clown sightings have also been reported in Clinton, Versailles and University of Missouri campus.
====Montana==== On October 12, a 15-year-old boy was cited for disorderly conduct for an alleged October 5 threat posted on Facebook. The threat was about a clown killing students at [[Missoula]] schools.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2016/10/13/montana-police-cite-student-over-clown-threat-statement.html|title=Montana police cite student over clown threat statement|agency=Associated Press|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref>
====Nebraska==== In early October, people dressed as clowns were spotted in [[Lincoln, NE|Lincoln]] and [[Grand Island, NE|Grand Island]]. On October 5, four teenage clowns were arrested for terroristic threats in Grand Island. One was in possession of a [[BB gun]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Manna, Nichole|url=http://journalstar.com/news/local/911/clowns-spotted-in-lincoln-teen-clowns-arrested-in-grand-island/article_004b7d51-b842-5859-9455-47c635278b1d.html|title=Clowns spotted in Lincoln; teen clowns arrested in Grand Island|publisher=''[[Lincoln Journal Star|Journal Star]]''|date=October 6, 2016|accessdate=October 6, 2016}}</ref>
====Nevada==== In [[Sparks, Nevada|Sparks]], three men were chased by a suspicious man, dressed like a clown wielding a [[machete]] near the Shadow Mountain Sports Complex. But then turned out to be fake and set up by the same three men who supposedly saw the clown.
====New Hampshire==== In [[Durham, New Hampshire]], UNH College Students (University of New Hampshire) reported to the police that a person dressed as a creepy clown was roaming the campus. Police followed up the report claiming that the clown was found with no weapons except a megaphone. It is unknown why the clown had a megaphone.
====New Jersey==== On Monday, October 4, at around 10pm, a male in a clown mask carrying a plastic machete scared a woman at a [[Quick Chek]] convenience store in [[Parsippany-Troy Hills, New Jersey|Parsippany]]. A second eyewitness also was scared by the same individual who then ran away through a hole in the fence at the rear of the building. Police officials were unable to locate the suspect initially, however they later identified the individual as a juvenile. Police officials stated that this was a misguided prank and was ultimately harmless.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nj.com/morris/index.ssf/2016/10/clown_carrying_a_plastic_machete_in_parsippany_was.html|title=Clown carrying a plastic machete in Parsippany was a juvenile, cops say|newspaper=NJ.com|access-date=2016-10-13}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nj.com/morris/index.ssf/2016/10/plastic_machete-wielding_clown_spotted_in_parsippa.html|title=Clown carrying plastic machete spotted in Parsippany, cops say|newspaper=NJ.com|access-date=2016-10-13}}</ref>
In [[Phillipsburg, New Jersey]], a boy claimed to have been chased by a clown with a sword. The boy says that he heard the clown say "I'm gonna get cha".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2016/09/28/new-jersey-creepy-clowns/|title=New Jersey Child Says He Was Chased By Creepy Clown With Sword|publisher=CBS|date=September 28, 2016|author=Vanessa Murdock}}</ref>
People dressed as clowns were also spotted in [[Bound Brook, New Jersey|Bound Brook]], [[Hunterdon County, New Jersey|Hunterdon]], [[Monroe Township, Middlesex County, New Jersey|Monroe]], [[North Plainfield, New Jersey|North Plainfield]], [[Trenton, New Jersey|Trenton]], and [[Spotswood, New Jersey|Spotswood]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mycentraljersey.com/story/news/crime/jersey-mayhem/2016/10/03/creepy-clowns-spotted-bound-brook-spotswood/91473014/|title=Creepy clowns spotted in Bound Brook, Spotswood|author=Suzanne Russell|date=October 3, 2016|publisher=[[Courier News|My Central Jersey]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mycentraljersey.com/story/news/crime/jersey-mayhem/2016/10/04/latest-creepy-clown-sighting-no-laughing-manner/91565906/|title=Latest 'creepy clown' sighting no laughing matter|author=Suzanne Russell|date=October 4, 2016|publisher=[[Courier News|My Central Jersey]]}}</ref> A middle school student from [[Cinnaminson, New Jersey|Cinnaminson]] was detained for harassing students in a clown costume.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://philadelphia.cbslocal.com/2016/10/06/officials-students-terrorized-by-teen-running-around-in-clown-mask/|title=Officials: Students 'Terrorized' By Teen Running Around In Clown Mask|first=Kristina|last=Dougherty|publisher=}}</ref>
====New Mexico==== In the first week of October, police in [[Hobbs, NM|Hobbs]] received multiple reports of clown sightings. No arrests have yet been made.<ref>{{cite web|author=Cope, Cheyenne|url=http://krqe.com/2016/10/04/hobbs-police-receiving-calls-about-clown-sightings/|title=Hobbs Police receiving calls about clown sightings|publisher=[[KRQE]]|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=October 7, 2016}}</ref> In the second week of October, there were reports of clowns armed with baseball bats walking around [[Roswell, New Mexico|Roswell]].<ref name="abq"/>
On October 9, three juveniles with clown masks were arrested outside a children's clothing store in [[Albuquerque]]. They were found in possession of a firearm.<ref name="abq">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2016/10/09/3-juveniles-in-albuquerque-caught-with-clown-masks-handgun.html|title=3 juveniles in Albuquerque caught with clown masks, handgun|agency=Associated Press|date=October 9, 2016}}</ref>
====New York==== On September 28 and 29, sightings were reported in [[Brentwood, New York|Brentwood]] and [[North Babylon, New York|North Babylon]] on [[Long Island]].<ref name=":1">{{cite news|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2016/09/30/creepy-clowns-long-island/|title=Creepy Clown Sightings Reported In and Clifton Park and Brentwood, North Babylon|access-date=2016-10-01|date=September 30, 2016}}</ref> The [[North Babylon Union Free School District|North Babylon School District]] and Shenendehowa School District went on "lockout" the following day, and the Lindenhurst School District employed precautions.<ref name=":1" /> A "lockout" means that nobody is allowed to enter or leave during class hours.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/clown-related-threats-cause-long-island-high-school-lockdown|title=Two Schools Just Went on Lockdown Because of 'Clown-Related Threats'|first=Kate|last=Dwyer|publisher=[[Teen Vogue]]|date=September 28, 2016}}</ref> A Twitter account called "[[Suffolk County, New York|Suffolk]] Clowns" ([https://twitter.com/liclowns @LIClowns]) emerged, making (possibly joking) threats to numerous school districts and posting pictures of clowns. However, the account has since been suspended.
On October 5, a man in clown clothing intimidated a 16-year-old boy with a knife on a [[Manhattan]] subway and tried to block him from walking through the doorway as the subway was about to enter the [[96th Street (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|96th Street station]]. The boy ran out of the station, and the man fled. On October 13, a 53-year-old man was arrested and charged with menacing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/Clown-Knife-Menace-Chase-Subway-Riders-New-York-City-Manhattan-Police-Arrest-397064111.html|title=Man in Clown Garb Arrested in Knife Subway Menacing of Teenage Boy|publisher=[[NBC New York]]|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref> On October 8, a clown was sighted on the campus of [[Rockland Community College|SUNY Rockland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/1680378428959251/photos/a.1680404768956617.1073741828.1680378428959251/1681901052140322/?type=3&theater|title=Rockland County Clown Outbreak – Timeline – Facebook|date=|work=facebook.com}}</ref> On October 9, a clown was seen trying to lure people into the woods in [[Sloatsburg, New York|Sloatsburg]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/1680378428959251/photos/a.1680404768956617.1073741828.1680378428959251/1682601318736962/?type=3&theater|title=Rockland County Clown Outbreak – Timeline – Facebook|date=|work=facebook.com}}</ref> On October 10, a clown chased down a girl who was walking her dog at [[Harriman State Park (New York)|Harriman State Park]] <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/1680378428959251/photos/a.1680404768956617.1073741828.1680378428959251/1683145882015839/?type=3&theater|title=Rockland County Clown Outbreak – Timeline – Facebook|date=|work=facebook.com}}</ref>
After a sighting at [[St. Bonaventure University]], school officials issued a statement on October 5 requesting that students not take matters into their own hands when confronting potentially dangerous situations. Reports say that students had created a sign-up sheet for an "Anti-Clown Army" and students were later seen roaming the campus armed with baseball bats.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.twcnews.com/nys/buffalo/news/2016/10/5/st--bonaventure-university-officials-clowns-students-attack.html |title=St. Bonaventure University Officials Urge Students to Not Attack Clowns |date=5 October 2016 |publisher=Time Warner Cable News}}</ref>
====North Carolina==== On September 4, children in a Winston-Salem neighborhood reported to the police about a person dressed as a clown trying to lure them into some woods. They described him as wearing white overalls and gloves, red shoes, and bushy, red hair. His face was described as white with a red nose. They claim that he offered them treats if they would go with him. According to police, an adult heard, but did not see, the clown.<ref name="auto"/>
On September 7, a witness reported seeing a person wearing a scary clown mask, red curly wig, yellow dotted shirt, blue clown pants and clown shoes exited the woods by an apartment complex around 10 a.m. in Greensboro, although the clown disappeared after another witness attempted to chase down the clown with a machete.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/man-machete-chases-clown-spotted-woods-nc-article-1.2781439 |title=Man with machete chases after clown spotted near woods in Greensboro, North Carolina |publisher=nydailynews.com |date=7 September 2016}}</ref>
====North Dakota==== On October 10, police in [[Rolla, North Dakota|Rolla]] received reports of a person dressed as a clown armed with a machete.<ref>{{cite web|author=Chase, Ken|url=http://www.wdaz.com/news/north-dakota/4133580-police-searching-clown-machete-rolla|title=Police searching for clown with machete in Rolla|publisher=[[WDAZ]]|date=October 10, 2016}}</ref>
====Ohio==== On September 27, at about 2 am, a woman called [[Lancaster, Ohio|Lancaster]] police and reported that she had seen a clown with a large kitchen knife in its hand. Witnesses at the location told police that they had seen two clowns, one wearing a gold suit with balloon and the other wearing all black. Police failed to find them.<ref name="auto">{{cite news|url=http://www.wfmynews2.com/news/nation/what-we-know-about-creepy-clown-reports/328041526|title=What We Know About Creepy Clown Reports|first=Ashley|last=May|date=September 30, 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
On September 29, a woman was attacked while on her porch while she was smoking. She claimed that a man dressed as a clown grabbed her throat and said "I should just kill you now..."<ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=http://www.abc15.com/news/national/creepy-clown-sightings-increase-across-greater-cincinnati|title=Clown attack forces several schools in Ohio to cancel Friday's classes|author=T.J. Parker|author2=Rose-Ann Aragon|author3=WCPO Staff|date=30 September 2016|publisher=ABC}}</ref> The victim also stated that he said that "some students and teachers would wish they were never born at the junior and senior high school today."<ref name="auto1"/> That prompted [[Reading, Ohio|Reading]] school superintendent Chuck LaFata to cancel Friday classes in the area, prompting local private school [[Mount Notre Dame High School|Mount Notre Dame]] to close as well.<ref name="auto1"/><ref name="fox4">{{cite web|url=http://fox4kc.com/2016/09/30/school-district-shuts-down-after-creepy-clown-attack/|title=School district shuts down after creepy clown attack|date=2016-09-30|publisher=[[WDAF-TV]]}}</ref> Also, a junior high student was arrested after making a clown-related threat using the Internet.<ref name="auto1"/>
On Sunday, October 2, a total of seven people were arrested in [[Cincinnati]] over clown-related threats. These students were charged with inciting panic for allegedly suggesting a "Clown Clan" descend on their schools.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/seven-now-arrested-over-clown-threats-in-ohio/ |title=More arrests in Ohio amid growing rash of clown-related threats |date=2 October 2016 |publisher=CBS news}}</ref> On October 4, a [[Speedway LLC|Speedway]] gas station in [[Dayton, Ohio|Dayton]] was robbed by three individuals, one wearing a surgical mask, one a [[Guy Fawkes mask]] and one a clown mask.<ref name="speedwayrobbery">{{Cite news|url=http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/crime--law/can-you-pipe-wielding-suspects-masks-who-rob-speedway/g6kge3S0jJRJvbOJTWlMcK/|title=Can you ID pipe-wielding suspects in masks who rob Speedway?|publisher=[[Dayton Daily News]]|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
In response to the various incidents, the sheriff of [[Darke County, Ohio|Darke County]], Toby Spencer, posted a challenge to those who might consider pulling a clown prank, that "...as of today we have issued 6,125 (concealed carry) permits in Darke County alone. You might also ask yourself how your luck will be today."<ref name="darkesheriff">{{Cite news|url=http://www.mydaytondailynews.com/news/news/clown-chaos-leads-to-school-closings-felony-arrest/nshyd/|title=Clown chaos leads to school closings, felony arrest|first=Jeremy P.|last=Kelley|publisher=Dayton Daily News|date=September 30, 2016|accessdate=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
It was thought that clowns would visit a school in [[Lowellville, Ohio|Lowellville]] which prompted a police investigation.<ref>[http://www.lowellville.k12.oh.us/userfiles/25/my%20files/clown%20letter%2009.30.16.pdf?id=20941 notice to all families] September 30, 2016</ref>
====Oklahoma==== There have been sightings in [[Oklahoma City]], [[Moore, Oklahoma|Moore]], [[McAlester, Oklahoma|McAlester]], [[Tulsa]], and [[Chickasha, Oklahoma|Chickasha]], as well as [[Miami, Oklahoma|Miami]].
During the evening of October 7, 2016, several residents of a Moore, Oklahoma neighborhood confronted two individuals clad in clown clothing, warning them of the serious consequences they could face if they persisted in their activities. The two individuals had apparently been loitering at a neighborhood playground, lurking around suspiciously and scaring children. During the confrontation one clown fled, but the other clown stayed for the duration of the lecture, eventually coming to see the truth in what the residents were saying – and removing his clown costume.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kfor.com/2016/10/07/theyre-going-to-get-hurt-moore-residents-confront-creepy-clowns-lurking-near-park/|title="They're going to get hurt," Moore residents confront 'creepy clowns' lurking near park|date=2016-10-08|website=KFOR.com|access-date=2016-10-08}}</ref>
On October 16, 2016 just outside the city limits of [[Pryor, Oklahoma]] a female motorist was reportedly attacked by two clowns after being flagged down by a woman posing as a motorist in need of assistance. She said the clowns forcibly dragged the motorist from her vehicle, choked her, extinguished a [[cigarette]] on her face, and wrote the words "clown posse" on her forehead.<ref name="KOTV"/> She later confessed to having made up the story and said she was responsible for her injuries.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oklahoma woman could face charges over clown attack report|url=http://newsok.com/article/5524787|work=NewsOK.com|last=Stogsdill|first=Sheila|date=October 31, 2016|accessdate=October 31, 2016}}</ref>
====Oregon==== A woman reported on September 30 that a clown tried to break into her car near the [[O'Bryant Square]] in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oregonlive.com/portland/index.ssf/2016/09/woman_says_she_was_attacked_by.html|title=Woman says she was accosted by clown in downtown Portland|publisher=[[Oregon Live]]|date=September 30, 2016}}</ref> A man was arrested in [[Central Point, Oregon|Central Point]] on October 5 after posting pictures of himself dressed as a clown and trespassing at various local high schools. He was booked into the [[Jackson County, Oregon|Jackson County]] Jail and faces charges of disorderly conduct and second-degree trespassing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kgw.com/news/local/southern-oregon/scary-clown-arrest-made-in-southern-oregon/329458177|title=Scary clown arrest made in southern Oregon|publisher=[[KGW]]|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
On October 6, a 55-year-old man in a clown mask was arrested for menacing at Floyd Light Middle School in Portland. An assistant principal confronted the man, who then allegedly threatened to hurt him. The suspect is facing charges of menacing and disorderly conduct.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kgw.com/news/crime/man-wearing-clown-mask-boxing-gloves-threatens-assistant-principal-outside-school/329621924|title=Man wearing clown mask, boxing gloves threatens assistant principal outside school|publisher=[[KGW]]|date=October 6, 2016}}</ref> There has been at least eight "scary clown" sightings, and police responding in some cases, in [[Douglas County, Oregon|Douglas County]] since October 1, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Eight 'Scary Clowns' reportedly seen in Douglas County since Oct. 1|work=[[The News-Review]]|author=Ian Campbell|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
====Pennsylvania==== On September 18, 2016, in [[Pennsylvania State College|State College]], a person dressed as a clown was seen acting strangely at the parking lot of a [[YMCA]] early in the morning.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.collegian.psu.edu/news/crime_courts/article_5057d71c-7dfe-11e6-8c36-9f408d3390b9.html |title=Strange clown sightings by State College YMCA |date=18 September 2016}}</ref> In late September, reports stated that an individual dressed as an angry clown was seen with a knife around the wooded areas behind [[Wilkes-Barre Area School District|Kistler Elementary School]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.publicopiniononline.com/story/news/local/2016/09/23/pa-clown-sightings-police-responding-another-possible-incident/90896158/ |title=Pa. clown sightings: Police responding to another possible incident |date=23 September 2016}}</ref> Rumors of a clown threatening the Cumberland Valley school district have also been reported. [[York College of Pennsylvania|York College]] students have reported numerous sightings on and off the campus.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2016/09/27/clown-sightings-reach-york-college/91181900/|title=Clown sightings reach York College|access-date=2016-10-01}}</ref> Both the Erie Police Department and the Pennsylvania State Police confirmed that in the city of Erie, there has been multiple clown sightings during the month of September.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.erienewsnow.com/story/33267243/creepy-clown-sightings-reported-in-erie |title=Creepy Clown Sightings Reported in Erie |date=4 October 2016}}</ref>
On September 25, 2016, 16-year-old Christian Torres was found stabbed to death on the front porch following a scuffle during a party in [[Reading, Pennsylvania|Reading]] when a man wearing a clown mask showed up at the party.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/police-hunt-killer-clown-who-stabbed-teenage-boy-death-pennsylvania-1583626 |title=Police hunt for 'killer clown' who stabbed teenage boy to death in Pennsylvania |date=31 October 2016}}</ref> The assailant, 29-year-old Avery Valentin-Bair was later arrested & charged with first degree murder.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pennlive.com/news/2016/09/man_arrested_in_stabbing_death.html |title=Man arrested in stabbing death of boy with clown mask |date=31 October 2016}}</ref>
In October, a clown was arrested after threatening kids on their way to school in [[Whitehall, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania|Whitehall, Allegheny County]]. On October 3, 2016, the Pennsylvania State Police issued a "Community Awareness Bulletin" which specifically addressed the reports that have been appearing in news and social media around the country. The general tone of the bulletin was cautionary, yet at the same time it reinforced the notion that many of the threats specific to clowns attacking schools had "not been validated". The bulletin also recalls the 1980s clown sightings in various US cities, as well as providing a phone number, email address and information about a smartphone app that citizens can use to report suspicious behavior to authorities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.psp.pa.gov/for%20media/Documents/socialmedia/CAB%20005-16.pdf|title=Recent Threats to Pennsylvania Schools|date=October 3, 2016|website=|publisher=Pennsylvania State Police|access-date=}}</ref> That same day the ''Bucks County Courier Times'' interviewed Joyce Meder, also known as "Bubbles the Clown" regarding the "creepy clown" phenomenon. Meder is an Abington, PA-based professional clown who provides entertainment for children. Describing herself as a "happy" and "fun" clown, Meder expressed disappointment over the recent clown scare, citing her newfound fears of possible run-ins with law enforcement when she is in public dressed as a clown. Meder goes on to say in the interview that she plans to turn to her colleagues in the professional clown community to "find out how they are being affected and what they're doing about this epidemic".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.buckscountycouriertimes.com/news/local/video-creepy-clown-phenomenon-hurting-abington-clown-s-business/html_67c44472-6f62-562d-8eb1-b6ed29f2598a.html|title=Video: Creepy clown phenomenon hurting Abington clown's business|last=Menno|first=Video by Christian|newspaper=Bucks County Courier Times|access-date=2016-10-11}}</ref>
After an alleged sighting at [[University Park, Pennsylvania|University Park]], on October 3, [[Pennsylvania State University|Penn State]] students gathered together for a "clown hunt". Reports say that the number of students attended this hunt ranged from 500 to 1,000. Following the riot/hunt, the police stated that they did not believe that there were any actual clown sightings, but also stated that there was no property damage, no injury and no violence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.centredaily.com/news/local/article105808156.html |title=Penn State students flood downtown, campus over clowns |date=4 October 2016 |publisher=Centre Daily}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://heavy.com/news/2016/10/creepy-clowns-penn-state-riot-lock-down-campus-college-threatening-video-pennsylvania/ |title=Penn State Creepy Clowns: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know |date=4 October 2016 |publisher=Heavy}}</ref>
====Puerto Rico==== At least ten cases of sightings were reported in [[Puerto Rico]], including a clown being reported lurking around a [[Guaynabo]] home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telemundopr.com/noticias/Alegan-que-Payaso-misterioso-acecha-residencia-en-Guaynabo-telemundo-puerto-rico-396453041.html|title=They argue that clown stalks residence in Guaynabo|publisher=''[[Telemundo]]''|date=October 9, 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref>
On October 12, in [[Rio Piedras]], a trio of clowns robbed a couple on a street. In the following week, a man reported in Rio Piedras that he was robbed at gunpoint by a clown and had his phone and cash stolen.<ref>{{cite web|author=Perez, Maribel Hernandez|url=http://www.primerahora.com/noticias/policia-tribunales/nota/reportannuevaquerelladepayasoladronenriopiedras-1182265/|title=Report new complaint clown thief in Rio Piedras|date=October 17, 2016}}</ref>
====Rhode Island==== On October 4, 2016, the Providence Journal reported that social media threats were made against [[William E. Tolman High School|Tolman High School]] and Goff Junior High in [[Pawtucket, Rhode Island|Pawtucket]] that prompted rumors of clown sightings. There was also reports of a clown with a machete chasing people out of [[Slater Park]] on three separate occasion and that a clown was seen hanging around schools in the same city.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.providencejournal.com/news/20161004/like-war-of-worlds-ri-police-grapple-with-creepy-clown-hysteria |title='Like War of the Worlds': R.I. police grapple with 'creepy clown' hysteria |date=4 October 2016 |publisher=Providence Journal}}</ref> A teenage boy was arrested soon after for making threats against schools on social media involving clown masks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.providencejournal.com/news/20161007/pawtucket-teenager-arrested-charged-with-clown-threats-against-school |title=Pawtucket teenager arrested, charged with clown threats against school |date=7 October 2016 |publisher=Providence Journal}}</ref> In [[Coventry, Rhode Island|Coventry]], elementary school students had to spend their recess indoors after a social media post stated that a clown was going to appear at Hopkins Hill School.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.providencejournal.com/news/20161007/clown-threat-ruins-recess-for-students-at-coventry-elementary-school |title=Clown threat ruins recess for students at Coventry elementary school |date=7 October 2016 |publisher=Providence Journal}}</ref>
An overweight clown was spotted in [[Roger Williams Park]].
====South Carolina==== Although sightings were initially reported in [[South Carolina]] in mid-August, the phenomenon began to spread north from late August through the end of September.
On August 21, 2016, there was an alleged clown sighting in [[Greenville, SC|Greenville]] at the Fleetwood Manor Apartment complex. Children in the complex reportedly witnessed clowns or a group of clowns attempting to whisper or talk to the children. The children told their parents that the clowns, equipped with "flashing green laser lights", said they lived in an abandoned house in the woods near a small lake. Greenville police came to the complex to investigate, and did find a trail in the woods leading to a house and a small lake, but no evidence of clowns or clown paraphernalia was found.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/clown-sightings-south-carolina-creepy-details-released/|title=Creepy details released in South Carolina clown sightings|access-date=2016-10-07}}</ref> While some of these reports have been harmless, others reports have been more suspicious. In one instance, a woman reported a person in a clown costume was standing in her backyard and ran away as she took a picture.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fox6now.com/2016/09/01/this-is-serious-creepy-clown-sightings-reported-in-second-community-in-south-carolina/ |title="This is serious:" Creepy clown sightings reported in second community in South Carolina |date=1 September 2016 |publisher=Fox 6}}</ref> In one case, an individual had heard clanging chains and a banging noise at his front door. While other cases report a clown offering money or candy to children to follow the clown into the woods.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/31/us/creepy-clown-sightings-in-south-carolina-cause-a-frenzy.html |title=Creepy Clown Sightings in South Carolina Cause a Frenzy |date=30 August 2016 |work=New York Times}}</ref>
====South Dakota==== On October 4, a 19-year-old man in a clown costume was arrested on the campus of [[South Dakota State University]] in [[Brookings, SD|Brookings]] for disorderly conduct. He was allegedly scaring students.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ksfy.com/content/news/Man-dressed-in-clown-costume-arrested-on-SDSU-campus-396363641.html|title=Man dressed in clown costume arrested on SDSU campus|publisher=[[KSFY]]|date=October 7, 2016}}</ref>
====Tennessee==== On September 19, in [[Summitville, Tennessee|Summitville]], a 15-year-old boy was cut with a knife by a man in a clown mask.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nbc4i.com/2016/09/21/tennessee-teen-says-he-was-attacked-by-a-clown-with-a-knife/|title=Tennessee teen says he was attacked by a clown with a knife|agency=Associated Press|date=September 21, 2016}}</ref>
On September 28, at [[Carson-Newman University]] in [[Jefferson City, Tennessee|Jefferson City]], there were reportedly clown sightings on campus.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=tnttristan |number=780981216765943808 |date=28 Sep 2016|title=Carson-Newman of all places has clowns on the campus........ |author=Tristan Thomas}}</ref>
====Texas==== On September 30, 2016 clown-themed threats were made against [[Temple High School (Texas)|the high school]] in [[Temple, Texas|Temple]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tdtnews.com/news/article_3ec1d314-875d-11e6-a641-f77c1cb43bf6.html|title=Temple clown threats investigated|author1=Dominguez, Crystal |author2=McKeon, Deborah|date=2016-09-30|publisher=''[[Temple Daily Telegram]]''}}</ref>
On October 3, 2016, a person dressed as a clown attacked a person at a housing complex at [[Texas State University]]. The victim said the alleged clown tried to grab her before she could pull away. The suspect then left in an unknown direction, according to University police.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.kvue.com/news/local/texas-state-student-attacked-by-man-dressed-as-clown-school-says/329059619|title=Texas State student attacked by man dressed as clown, school says|last=TEGNA|newspaper=KVUE|language=English|access-date=2016-10-07}}</ref>
On October 5, 2016, the Tuloso-Midway Independent School District, which has about 4,000 students in its five schools, ordered a lockdown about 9 a.m. Wednesday after a bus driver and a monitor on the bus said they saw a clown sitting inside a vehicle near one of the schools, superintendent Sue Nelson said.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://time.com/4520262/texas-school-clown-lockdown/|title=Texas School District on Lockdown After 2 Clown Sightings|last=Chan|first=Melissa|website=TIME.com|access-date=2016-10-07}}</ref>
On the morning of October 6, residents reported that a clown was knocking on doors of homes in a [[Manor, Texas|Manor]] neighborhood. An 18-year-old man was arrested, and police found a clown mask that belonged to the suspect.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Ricke, Claire |author2=Rangel, Leslie |url=http://kxan.com/2016/10/06/police-arrest-masked-clown-in-manor/|title=Masked clown arrested in Manor|publisher=[[KXAN]]|date=October 6, 2016}}</ref>
[[Houston Independent School District]] schools were placed on lockdown following clown-related threats posted on social media.<ref name="axford"/> On October 11, a [[Gainesville, TX|Gainesville]] home was broken into by three clown-masked teenagers, and the homeowner was shot in the face and arm with a BB gun. A 13-year-old male and two 14-year-old males were arrested.<ref name="axford">{{cite web|author=Axford, Will|url=http://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/texas/article/Teenagers-who-wore-clown-masks-in-home-shooting-9969394.php|title=Teenagers who wore clown masks during burglary, shooting arrested|publisher=''[[Houston Chronicle]]''|date=October 13, 2016}}</ref>
====Utah==== On October 3, 2016, in [[St. George, Utah]], a woman reported to police that while she was walking, someone dressed as a clown had exited a vehicle and chased her, though in follow-up interviews she clarified that the individual had merely stared at her without saying or doing anything to her.
Also on October 3, 2016, near midnight in [[Provo, Utah]], a woman reported to police that someone dressed as a clown ran across her suburban yard.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/one-confirmed-clown-sighting-in-provo-among-dozens-of-concerned/article_3f0dce0a-9140-5f9b-87bf-197c79a78cd6.html|title=One confirmed clown sighting in Provo among dozens of concerned reports|date=2016-10-04|author=Hanson, Kurt|publisher=[[Daily Herald (Utah)|''The Daily Herald'' (Utah)]]}}</ref>
====Vermont==== On October 5, in [[Williston, Vermont|Williston]], a 15-year-old boy was arrested after being accused of wearing a clown mask and banging the classroom windows of Jean Garvin Youth and Family Services School. He faced charges of disorderly conduct and inducing panic.<ref>{{cite web|author=McKend, Eva|url=http://www.wcax.com/story/33325362/creepy-clown-panics-students-staff-at-vt-school|title=Robocalls released after creepy clown panics students, staff at Vt. school|publisher=[[WCAX]]|date=October 5, 2016}}</ref>
====Virginia==== On September 25, 2016, the Augusta County Sheriff's Office was notified about sightings in the 100 block of River Bend Road in [[Fort Defiance, Virginia|Fort Defiance]]. The call came from a resident who was fishing in the area with his two boys. According to the resident, he was approached by people fleeing the area after spotting several clowns in the nearby woods. As of October 27, 2016, no arrests have been made in this case.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyprogress.com/news/state/clown-sightings-grow-in-virginia-police-urge-care/article_ac14bc96-84cf-11e6-930c-1fd1e958482c.html|title=Clown sightings grow in Virginia, police urge care|first=Michelle L.|last=Mittchell|publisher=The News Virginian}}</ref>
On October 6, 2016, a clown was reported on the campus of [[James Madison University]]. Students armed with pepper spray and baseball bats formed posses to hunt the clown down, although the sighting was later revealed to be a hoax.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pressreader.com/usa/the-washington-post/20161006/281509340690062|title=PressReader.com – Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/scary-clown-rumors-threats-feed-hysteria-leading-to-school-lockdowns-arrests/2016/10/05/1adf27c4-8b0b-11e6-bff0-d53f592f176e_story.html|title=Scary clown rumors, threats feed hysteria, leading to school lockdowns, arrests|first=|last=http://www.facebook.com/TReesShapiro|website=Washington Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whsv.com/content/news/JMU-students-join-together-to-search-for-on-campus-clown-that-turns-out-to-be-a-hoax-395835501.html|title=JMU students join together to search for on-campus clown that turns out to be a hoax|first=Caleb|last=Stewart|publisher=}}</ref>
Virginia law prohibits anyone over 16 from wearing a mask to conceal one's identity.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsleader.com/story/news/local/2016/09/25/augusta-county-sheriff-warns-possible-clown-sightings/91100430/|title=Sheriff warns of possible clown sightings in county|access-date=2016-10-01}}</ref>
====Washington==== On October 3, several students at Rogers High School in [[Puyallup, Washington|Puyallup]] received text messages of a person dressed as a clown threatening to kill students at the school. A person reported that a person dressed as a clown was seen wielding a knife near the school campus on the following morning. On October 4, the school was put on lock down and police found two clown masks in the woods adjacent to the school. Two other [[Pierce County, Washington|Pierce County]] schools [[Emerald Ridge High School]] and Glacier View Junior High were closed down on October 4 due to threats. The case is being investigated by both the [[Pierce County Sheriff's Office]] and the [[FBI]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Robertson, Kipp|url=http://mynorthwest.com/410319/threat-forces-administration-to-close-puyallup-schools/|title=Puyallup school locked down after reports of knife-wielding clowns|publisher=mynorthwest.com|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref>
====Washington, D.C.==== In early October, a 14-year-old girl was arrested for phoning a clown-related threat to McKinley Middle School.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox5dc.com/news/local-news/210384918-story|title=Teen girl arrested for making clown-related phone threats against DC middle school|publisher=[[FOX5DC]]|date=October 7, 2016}}</ref>
====West Virginia==== In early October, in [[Fairmont, West Virginia|Fairmont]], a 34-year-old man was arrested on a charge of assault after an incident was reported in which a man was wearing a clown mask, carrying a baseball bat, and chased four children, ages 6 to 11.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wvgazettemail.com/news-cops-and-courts/20161004/wv-man-wearing-clown-mask-chases-kids-with-baseball-bat|title=WV man wearing clown mask chases kids with baseball bat|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|date=October 4, 2016}}</ref>
====Wisconsin==== On August 1, 2016, near the beginning of this spate of sightings, Wisconsin residents reported seeing Gags the Green Bay Clown. There has been speculation that this clown is related to an independent horror film due to premiere around [[Halloween]].<ref name="lohud.com">{{cite news|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/nation-now/2016/09/28/what-we-know-creepy-clown-reports-across-nation/91171858/|title=Serious or just a sick joke? What we know about creepy clown reports|author=Ashley May|date=28 September 2016|work=[[The Journal News|lohud.com]]|accessdate=7 October 2016}}</ref>
On October 7, 2016, a [[Menasha, Wisconsin|Menasha]] couple dressed up as clowns were arrested for child negligence for leaving their 4-year-old child alone at home while they were outside scaring people.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://wbay.com/2016/10/10/police-menasha-couple-arrested-for-child-neglect-after-clown-prank/|title=Police: Menasha couple arrested for Child Neglect after clown prank |author1=Roberts, Rhonda |author2=Matesic, Emily |date=October 10, 2016|work=[[WBAY]]|accessdate=October 11, 2016}}</ref>
====Wyoming==== In early October, creepy clowns were reported by citizens to be walking around [[maze]]s and taking selfies in [[Natrona County]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.kgwn.tv/content/news/Creepy-clown-sightings-impact-Wyoming-corn-maze-396895811.html|title=Creepy clown sightings impact Wyoming corn maze|author=Roth, Justin|date=October 12, 2016|work=[[KGWN]]|accessdate=October 26, 2016}}</ref>
===Internet=== In one example, threats of violence and the same image of a clown referred to a minimum of 24 schools in Arizona Valley's [[Phoenix Union High School District|Phoenix Union]] and Glendale school districts.<ref name="Thousands of students skip class">{{cite news|url=http://abc13.com/news/thousands-of-students-skip-class-after-clown-threats/1529983/ |title=Thousands of students skip class after clown threats |date=28 September 2016 |publisher=ABC News}}</ref>
On Monday, September 26, around 1,500 of [[Maryvale High School (Phoenix, Arizona)|Marydale High School]]'s students (nearly half of all students) did not attend after the first threats appeared on the Internet.<ref name="Thousands of students skip class" />
On October 1, schools in [[Hamburg, Pennsylvania]] were locked down because of a clown threat on Facebook and Twitter by a group with the name "Aint Clownin Around." The message read "We will be at all High schools this friday to either {{sic|kidnapp}} students or kill teachers going to they cars ...#WeNotClowninAround."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.readingeagle.com/news/article/hamburg-schools-were-on-lockdown-due-to-clown-threat |title=Hamburg schools were on lockdown due to clown threat |author=Michael Yoder|date=1 October 2016|work=Reading Eagle}}</ref>
In [[Philadelphia]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://6abc.com/news/phila-schools-police-taking-scary-clown-threats-seriously/1536124/ |title=PHILADELPHIA POLICE: GIRL,13, MADE 'CLOWN THREATS' TOWARD SCHOOLS |date=3 October 2016 |publisher=6 ABC|author=Jeannette Reyes}}</ref> threats against students and schools have been posted at social media sites, prompting the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] and a terrorism task force to help police investigate. The exact nature of these threats has not been made public.{{citation needed|date=October 2016}}
Such threats on social media have also affected two grade schools in Alabama,<ref name="legalinsurrection.com">{{cite web|url=http://legalinsurrection.com/2016/09/police-called-to-auburn-university-over-clown-sightings/ |title=Police Called to Auburn University Over Clown Sightings|author=Aleister|publisher=Legalinsurrection.com |date= September 21, 2016 |accessdate=2016-10-04}}</ref> [[Auburn University]],<ref name="legalinsurrection.com"/> [[Fairborn High School]], [[Columbus, Ohio]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/seven-now-arrested-over-clown-threats-in-ohio/ |title=More arrests in Ohio amid growing rash of clown-related threats |publisher=CBS News |date= October 2, 2016|accessdate=2016-10-04}}</ref> some [[Las Vegas]] area schools,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lasvegas.cbslocal.com/2016/10/01/rumored-clown-threats-rile-some-las-vegas-students/ |title=Rumored Clown Threats Rile Some Las Vegas Students | KXNT 840 AM |publisher=CBS Las Vegas |date= |accessdate=2016-10-04}}</ref> and many more around the country.{{citation needed|date=October 2016}}
==Commentary== Explanations include that some clown sightings were promotional stunts for [[Rob Zombie]]'s ''[[31 (film)|31]]'' or [[Andy Muschietti|Andrés Muschietti]]'s [[It (2017 film)|2017 film adaptation]] of [[Stephen King]]'s novel ''[[It (novel)|It]]'', both of which feature one or more characters dressed as clowns.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/09/07/clown-sightings-have-spread-to-north-carolina-now-police-are-concerned-about-creepy-copycats/|title=Clown sightings have spread to North Carolina. Now police are concerned about creepy copycats.|author=Ben Guarino|date= September 7, 2016|work=The Washington Post|accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/sep/04/south-carolina-clown-sightings-could-be-part-of-film-marketing-stunt|title=South Carolina clown sightings could be part of film marketing stunt|publisher=Reuters|date=4 September 2016|work=The Guardian}}</ref>
Author and folklorist [[Benjamin Radford]], who wrote the non-fiction book ''Bad Clowns'', said that the craze could be an example of the "[[snowball effect]]", where rumor and legitimate concerns mix with the human penchant for a good story.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/10/05/health/creepy-clowns-rumors-trnd/index.html |title=What's with all the clowns everywhere? 6 legit possibilities |author=AJ Willingham |date=5 October 2016 |work=CNN |accessdate=6 October 2016}}</ref>
''[[The Verge]]'' dismissed the sightings as a case of [[mass hysteria]], stating that a [[Coulrophobia|fear of clown]]s (which is common in children and adults) may be an underlying cause.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theverge.com/2016/10/7/13191788/clown-attack-threats-2016-panic-hoax-debunked |title=The 2016 clown panic: 10 questions asked and answered |author=Angela Chen |date=7 October 2016 |work=The Verge |access-date=1 November 2016}}</ref> ''[[Vox (website)|Vox]]'' likewise claimed that "The Great Clown Panic of 2016 has been perpetuated by pretty much everyone except actual clowns."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.vox.com/culture/2016/10/12/13122196/clown-panic-hoax-history |title=The great clown panic of 2016 is a hoax. But the terrifying side of clowns is real. |date=12 October 2016 |access-date=3 November 2016 |author=Aja Romano |work=Vox}}</ref>
The [[American Horror Story: Cult|seventh season]] of anthology horror series ''[[American Horror Story]]'' seems to have{{citation needed|date=August 2018}} capitalised on this craze, where the main protagonists are members of a cult which terrorise and murder their victims whilst disguised as clowns.

{{Year nav|-652}} {{BC year in topic|652}}
The year '''652 BC''' was a year of the [[Roman calendar|pre-Julian Roman calendar]]. In the [[Roman Empire]], it was known as '''year 102 ''[[Ab urbe condita]]'' '''. The denomination 652 BC for this year has been used since the early medieval period, when the [[Anno Domini]] [[calendar era]] became the prevalent method in Europe for naming years.
== Events ==
=== Middle East ===
* [[Elam]] withdraws from her [[Military alliance|alliance]] with king [[Shamash-shum-ukin]] of [[Babylon]], who launches a premature attack on his half brother [[Ashurbanipal]] at year's end without waiting for reinforcements that have been promised by the [[Ancient Egypt|Egyptian]] king [[Psamtik I]].
=== Asia Minor ===
* Cimmerian forces from [[Anatolia]] conquer [[Sardis]] and reach the peak of their power. King [[Gyges of Lydia]] has spent most of his 28-year reign fighting his southern and western neighbors in an effort to gain [[suzerainty]] over all of Western [[Asia Minor]]. He has helped the rebellion of Psamtik I, but he receives no support from his erstwhile Assyrian ally Ashurbanipal. Gyges falls in a battle against the [[Cimmerians]] under king [[Tugdamme]] (approximate date). * [[Ardys of Lydia|Ardys]] succeeds his father Gyges as the second Mermnad king of [[Lydia]]. During his reign he finds payment of [[tribute]] to [[Assyria]] preferable to rule by the Cimmerians, who will be routed a few decades later.
=== Asia ===
* [[Guan Zhong]], Chinese [[chancellor]], urges [[Duke Huan of Qi]] to attack the small neighboring [[Xing (state)|State of Xing]] which is under attack from [[Quanrong|Quan Rong]] nomads. Later, he advises the duke not to ally with a [[vassal]] ruler's son who wishes to depose his father.

2010 [[France]] tour (folk rock)
2011 [[Paris]], [[France]] (folk rock)
2012 [[France]] tour (folk rock)
2012 [[Redon]], [[France]] (Renaissance) | awards = }} '''''Anne de Bretagne''''' is a [[rock opera]] by [[Alan Simon (musician)|Alan Simon]], based on the life of [[Anne of Brittany]]. The story follows the historical events that made her the last Duchess of independent [[Brittany]] and twice-crowned queen of France. ==Background== In 2007, Alan Simon visited an exhibition about Anne of Brittany at the [[Château des ducs de Bretagne]]. He got the idea to write an opera about Anne after seeing the [[reliquary]] of her heart; he then spent months researching her life. He wanted to write an opera connected to Brittany, and decided on Anne because "in spite of the hundreds of streets, hotels and schools that carried her name, no one knew her story".{{cite news|title=Bringing Anne de Bretagne back|url=http://www.connexionfrance.com/briging-anne-de-bretagne-back-to-life-11224-news-article.html|accessdate=11 March 2015|work=[[The Connexion]]|date=November 2010}} He wrote the opera based on [[Renaissance music]], [[classical music]] and [[folk rock]].{{cite news|last1=Sebillet|first1=Louise|title=La Duchesse Anne célébrée par un rock opéra|url=http://www.ouest-france.fr/la-duchesse-anne-celebree-par-un-rock-opera-2797149|accessdate=11 March 2015|work=[[Ouest-France]]|date=2 September 2014|language=fr}} ==Performances and recording== The recording for the studio album took place between August 2007 and February 2009, with more than 200 musicians participating. The first two performances took place on 29 and 30 June 2009, at [[Nantes]], in the courtyard of the [[castle of the Dukes of Brittany]]. On this occasion, the show was played in front of nearly 6000 people. The live show was recorded and later released on CD and DVD. Costumes for the show were designed by Jeanine Lérin-Cagnet and Elise Bossard. On 5–11 November 2010, a [[folk rock]] version of ''Anne de Bretagne'' was performed in [[Ploemeur]], [[Nantes]], [[Quimper]] and [[Rennes]]. This version had some changes compared to the original show—it was more [[Acoustic music|acoustic]] and did not have the [[bagad]] or symphony orchestra. There was also a new narrator, as [[Jean-Claude Dreyfus]] could not participate in the tour. For this tour, the narrator was Jean-Louis Jossic, who also played the role of Louis XII. In April 2012, the folk rock version was performed in [[Bouvron, Loire-Atlantique|Bouvron]], [[Romorantin-Lanthenay]], [[Rennes]] and [[Plougastel-Daoulas]]. There were some changes to the original cast, and the title role was played by Bleunwenn Mevel of [[Tri Yann]]. On 22 September 2012, a [[Renaissance music|Renaissance]] version was performed in [[Redon]]. On 19 September 2014, the show was performed in [[Vannes]] as part of Celti'Vannes, a Breton cultural festival. The festival coincided with the 500th anniversary of [[Anne of Brittany]]'s death. ==Characters== * Duchess [[Anne of Brittany]], Queen of France, wife of two kings of France. * [[Francis II, Duke of
